strIntroduction: See Bangkok in a different light as we explore this vibrant city by night. Gone are the surging crowds and frenetic market activities which dominate the daytime hours. Instead, you will discover a festival of illumination within the relative tranquility of the cool evening air. Traditional Chinese street lanterns mixed with multi-colored shop signs create a sublime ambiance as evening diners replace motorized commuters on Chinatown’s main thoroughfares. Although less hurried, there is still plenty to see as we visit Bangkok’s largest flower market, rising to full bloom during the night. Riding alongside the Chao Phraya River, we will see a scattering of vessels traversing the night waters as magical views of the Memorial Bridge, the Grand Palace, and Bangkok’s ever expanding skyline fill the horizon. Quieter, cooler, and beautifully lit with a potpourri of colors, Bangkok by night is an experience not to be missed. Join us and see why this is quickly becoming one of our most popular tours. Departures: Daily Tour time: 18:00 - 21:00
strTitle: Bangkok by Night (3-hour night bicycle tour)

strIntroduction: Experience all of the wonders of Co's Classical tour by cycling through Chinatown's frenetic and market evironment, through narrow streets and small side streets. Then allow classic longtail boats to transport us further into rural Bangkok. Discover why this city is often designated "Venice of the East" as our cruise introduces us to the charming canal lifestyle of Thais, much as it existed in bygone eras. Scenes of classical wooden-framed homes on stilts, mothers doing their daily washings, and kids splashing away the tropical heat will captivate us with their innocence and congeniality. Following this pleasant break, our cycle tour continues through luscious green belts as we explore the forgotten plantations of this great city. Surprising not in their beauty, but in their proximity to the sprawling metropolis, this tranquil ride will leave us pleasantly refreshed! Enjoy the quite country environment before continuing on the equally enthralling journey back to Chinatown. Departures: twice daily Tour times: 07:00 - 12:00 or 13:00 - 18:00
strTitle: Chinatown to the Gardens of Siam (5-hour bicycle/boat tour)

strIntroduction: PICK UP TIMES You can choose between four convenient pick up times from Chiang Mai 6.30 AM 8.00 AM 9.30 AM 12.30 PM All pick up times are approximate You will be dropped off back at your hotel approximately 5 to 6 hours after pick-up. ******************************************************************************************** PACKAGES JF 1 - Eco 40 Platforms - 22 Ziplines - Longest Zipline 400m JF 2 - Extreme (Suitable for 15 years or older) 34 Platforms - 22 Ziplines - Longest Zipline 1000m JF 3 - Ultimate (Suitable for 15 years or older) 39 Platforms - 19 Ziplines - Longest Zipline 1000m + Zipline Rollercoaster 1100m ******************************************************************************************** JUNGLE FLIGHT CHIANG MAI “I'm like a bird, I'll only fly away I don't know where my soul is, I don't know where my home is…” Nelly Furtado might still be searching, but you’re sure to find your home in the jungles of Thailand. After all, flying like a bird and exploring one of the most beautiful ecosystems in all of Asia does have a ring to it!! Located in one of the highest mountains of Thailand, Jungle Flight Chiang Mai is an action-packed adventure that lets you soar through the jungles in a Bond-esque manner, enjoying some of the most stunning scenes and experiences that this mesmerizing country has to offer. A day tour like no other, this adrenaline-pumping adventure is all about soaring through the jungle at a height of 50m above the rainforest floor, discovering one of the most precious and unique ecosystems on the planet. Why Zipline? A zip line is an aerial runway that truly lets you fly like a bird. Attached to the safety of harnesses, you zoom across the forest, enjoying a true bird’s eye view of the surrounding natural beauty without ever having to worry about growing a pair of wings. The jungles of Costa Rica and Nicaragua might have given birth to the concept of ziplining, but you don’t need to travel thousands of miles to enjoy this fun-filled adventure. Jungle Flight Chiang Mai offers a similar experience in the fastest, longest and highest zipline in all of Asia. The Scenery The scenery on display is absolutely mesmerizing. From spotting rare and exotic birds to enjoying mountain vistas to falling in love with the greenery all around you, there’s never a dull moment during this tour. Net walking, spiral staircases, nature walks, sky bridges and viewing platforms are a few other things to look forward to! Those who love adventure and excitement are sure to fall in love with Jungle Flight Chiang Mai. This is your opportunity to come close to a unique environment, fly with the birds and enjoy the very best of nature in the same action-packed adventure.
strTitle: 10% OFF Jungle Flight Chiang Mai: Highest Zipline Chiang Mai

strIntroduction: THE ORIGINAL BOND AND BEYOND TOUR Experience one of Phuket’s most popular day-trips, but with a flexible itinerary to beat the crowds… Jutting proudly out of Phang Nga Bay, Khao Phing Kan is an iconic sight, fondly remembered as the hideout of James Bond’s nemesis, Scaramanga, in The Man with the Golden Gun. Our superb full-day Phang Nga Bay tour takes you up close to the towering limestone peak for excellent views, as well as many other amazing destinations in this protected area. You’ll discover the magnificent Ice Cream Cave, with its hundreds of stalactites (pointing down) and stalagmites (rising up), board canoes to glide smoothly through a beautiful mangrove swamp, and take a tour of a traditional Muslim fishing village where the homes are built on stilts. ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE Sights Covered (Depending on the tide and how crowded it is, our sights or itinerary may slightly alter - This is to ensure the best tour possible for our guests) Phang Nga Bay James Bond Island Ice Cream Cave Mangrove Cave Panyee Village You’ll never forget this exciting James Bond Island tour, and it’s sure to be one of your best mementos of Thailand. Board our comfortable and stylish speedboat at the Royal Phuket Marina at 10am, and let us whisk you off into the lush beauty of Phang Nga Bay… We’ll slowly pass James Bond Island, giving you plenty of time to get the perfect photograph, and learn the story of this iconic Thai landmark. Then it’s on to the first stop, the spectacular Ice Cream Cave. Holding onto a wooden ladder, you’ll enter the famous Andaman Sea cave to see hundreds of stalactites and stalagmites formed over thousands of years - to many people they resemble giant dripping ice creams, hence the name. A lot of our guests recommend this as the absolute highlight of the tour - it is truly mind-blowing! The next cave, another jewel of Phang Nga Bay, is set within a mystical mangrove forest, and is thought to date back to Prehistoric times. You’ll be equipped with a well-fitting helmet and head torch so that you can explore further. Afterwards, we leave the speedboat for a while and slip into kayaks, to paddle easily through the enigmatic mangrove forest, another very popular experience with our guests. You almost feel as though you’re in another world, such is the silence and beauty all around. We’ll then head to Panyee Village for a delicious and authentic Thai seafood lunch, followed by a tour of this well-known fishing community. Resting on stilts, the colourful houses look as though they are floating in the bay, and it’s fascinating to wander around and watch scenes of daily village life going on all around. Before returning to Phuket, there will be time for a refreshing swim - we are pleased to say we can usually find an isolated spot where you can splash around and leap off the boat in peace. On arrival back at the marina, a minibus will be waiting to transfer you back to your accommodation. The memories of your day in Phang Nga Bay will stay with you for a long time. ************************************************************************************************ SIAM ADVENTURE WORLD For anyone visiting Phuket, a tour of Phang Nga Bay is a must, and consequently, it often gets busy, so book your place on our exciting Phuket speedboat tour to avoid the crowds. As one of Phuket’s top-rated tour operators, at Siam Adventure World we know that having a fast boat and a flexible itinerary means our guests can take their photos without lots of other people in the shot, swim in the sea with plenty of space, and take their time in every location, never feeling pushed out. Our multilingual crew are focused at all times on your comfort and enjoyment, with an emphasis on safety. We don’t overfill our boats, we use modern equipment and we take immense pride in the satisfaction of our passengers. For your convenience also, our tours always include air-conditioned return transportation between your accommodation and our luxury lounge at the Royal Phuket Marina. ************************************************************************************************ PICK-UP & DROP OFF (From and to any hotel in Phuket) Pick-up time - 6:30 AM (Approx) Drop-off - 5.00 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: James Bond Island & Phang Nga Bay Tour by Speed Boat

strIntroduction: PICK UP/ DROP OFF & ITINERARY Pick up : 8.15 AM (Approx) Drop Off : 5.30 PM (Approx) 10:30 AM : Arrive at the Siritarn Waterfalls 11:00 AM : Hill tribe village 11:30 AM : Wachiratarn Waterfalls 12:20 PM : Lunch at the local restaurant at Wachiratarn Waterfalls 1:00 PM : Easy walk along a nature trail to Thailand’s highest peak 2:00 PM : King and Queen Pagodas 3:00 PM : King’s Royal Projects 3:30 PM : Depart from Doi Inthanon National Park 5:30 PM : Return to your hotel in Chiang Mai ******************************************************************************************** YOUR DAY TOUR This is one tour that you wouldn’t want to miss out on! The Doi Inthanon National Park Day Tour not only lets you trek the highest peak in Thailand, it also presents natural beauty at its enchanting best. You get to visit lush jungles, explore alpine scenery, check out unending views and get closer to unique flora and fauna, and we haven’t even mentioned the Wachiritharn Waterfalls and Karen Hill Tribe village tours yet! The different ecosystems that exist here allow several types of flora and fauna to coexist making the Doi Inthanon National Park a dream come true for nature lovers. The lower parts of the park are covered with limestone rocks, unexplored caves and a lush forest which give way granite peaks. ******************************************************************************************** FLORA & FAUNA A trip to the Doi Inthanon National Park introduces you to several plants that cannot be found elsewhere. There’s an evergreen forest to explore with mosses, rhododendrons, green ferns and lianas to keep you company. Animals like barking deer, macaques, gibbons and monkeys make their presence felt and more than 360 species of birds can be seen here. ******************************************************************************************** THE WATERFALLS A Doi Inthanon National Park Day Tour would never be complete without visiting the Wachiritharn Waterfall. This impressive waterfall presents a mesmerizing sight, particularly during the rainy season, and is the perfect place to click some of the most memorable photographs in Thailand. There’s a picnic area where you can enjoy inspired lunches as well! The waterfall walk meanders along the side of the river with beautiful views all around you. There’s a place where you can enjoy a refreshing dip, but you need to come prepared to give that a try. ******************************************************************************************** DOI INTHANON - THE PEAK OF THAILAND The summit is typically covered in mist, but as you climb higher, you get to see mesmerizing views of Central Thailand, particularly between the months of November to February. These views alone make the Doi Inthanon National Park Day Tour worth your while. You also get to explore two pagodas that were built by the Royal Thai Air Force during your journey. ******************************************************************************************** CULTURAL JOURNEY - KAREN LONG NECK TRIBE Doi Inthanon hosts a number of Karen Hill Tribe and Hmong villages, all of which offer incredible cultural experiences. The people here grow crops like vegetables, coffee, flowers and fruits which are then sold all over the country, but over the years, they have also gained a reputation for welcoming guests into their community, showcasing unchanged lifestyles and tribal traditions in an entirely new light. The locals are immensely proud of their heritage and you get to learn about the history of the region, talk to monks and discover interesting titbits over a cup of coffee. Located at an hour’s drive from Chiang Mai, the Doi Inthanon National Park is a must see while visiting the country. It presents mesmerizing views, a remote untouched interior, great insights into the lifestyles of the tribal people of Thailand and the chance to watch exotic birds and animals, rejuvenate in waterfalls and visit beautiful pagodas near the summit.
strTitle: 10% OFF Doi Inthanon & Karen Hill Tribe Tour (Group Tour)

strIntroduction: The Bangkok Half Day Tour is one of our leading programs that show tourists and travelers three of the most spectacular temples in the city in a fully immersive, inspiring half-day tour. ************************************************************************************************ WAT TRAIMIT The first stop will be the Wat Traimit, otherwise known as the Temple of the Golden Buddha. It is quite a stunning sight to walk up to the Bangkok entrance and be greeted by the 5-ton monument of solid gold. You'll learn about this marvelous temple which was constructed during the Sukhothai period over 700 years ago! The golden Buddha was actually covered with plaster, to help hide it from the Burmese who were invading at the time. It then disappeared for many years and was rediscovered to the delight of archeologists only 40 years ago. You will find the statue housed in a beautiful newly built marble structure which, in itself, is a photographic event. As you explore the 2nd floor, you will find the exhibition of Phra Buddha Maha Suwanna Patimakorn, where you can learn the interesting way that the statue was made and its amazing history. Then, the 3rd floor hosts the Yaowarat Chinatown Heritage Centre. This is a museum where you can watch video exhibits to learn about the intriguing history of Bangkok’s Chinatown. ************************************************************************************************ WAT PHO After you have delighted at the Wat Traimit Bangkok Temple, you will re-board the mini-van with other tour guests and continue with the Bangkok Half Day Tour. It's always fun to share this experience with other excited travellers. You will pass through bustling Chinatown you just learned about on the way to the Wat Pho. Wat Pho is the oldest temple in Bangkok and is known as the Reclining Buddha, spanning an impressive 20 acres wide. When you enter into this temple you will see more than 1000 stunning Buddha images, most from the ruins of Ayutthaya and Sukhothai. It is quite an amazing experience. The Buddha is also incredibly impressive, at 46 meters long and 15 meters high. Its purpose is to portray the passing of Buddha into Nirvana – a true spectacle for the eyes. You will be asked to take off your shoes as you enter, and you have the option to purchase a bowl of coins at the entrance of the hall which can be dropped into the 108 bowls that line the temple. Doing so makes the experience immersive and fun. 108 is a significant number as it represents the 108 positive actions that helped lead Buddha towards enlightenment. ************************************************************************************************ WAT BENCHAMABOPIT Your last stop will be Wat Benchamabopit, otherwise known as the marble temple. Interestingly, this temple can be found on the back of a 5B coin. The breath-taking monastery was built with white Italian marble in 1899 at the request of the king. The temple's name translates to Temple of the fifth King located nearby Dusit Palace. It has a very European feel to its colors and architecture. Inside the ordination hall, you'll find gorgeous red carpets, deep blue tones within the artwork, gold-on- white motifs, and stained-glass windows, and a Sukhothai-style Buddha statue named Phra Buddhajinaraja. It is really a beautiful site and is nice to take some time to really admire the details in this temple. After Wat Benchamabopit, we will head back to the mini-van or bus to transport you back to your hotel. The Bangkok Half Day Tour is an experience you will not soon forget. All three temples have something interesting and inspiring to see and with our 3- hour tour, you will have plenty of time to take them all in. Additionally, all of our guides are locals who have insight into the history of the monuments and landmarks, so you can deepen your experience with knowledge you would not gain otherwise. We do not want to advertise this as a 'cheap' tour, but this is a great value trip for the sites you will visit and memories you will make to bring home for a life-time! ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP + DROP TIMES (From Central Hotels in Bangkok) Morning Tour - 7.15 AM (Approx) Afternoon Tour - 12.30 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Wat Traimit: Temple of Golden Buddha - Bangkok Half Day Tour

strIntroduction: On this tour you will explore Bangkok's markets, temples and food by night. Not only does it provide a great introduction to Bangkok for first time visitors, but also shows sides of Bangkok that even most repeat visitors have not seen. This tour does a large loop along Chao Praya river and passes by many of Bangkok's most iconic sites. We will stop and visit a combination of famous sites as well as less familiar ones. We will visit some of the places that most tourists only visit during the daytime including some of Bangkok's most famous temples such as Wat Pho. We will stop at the 24-hour Flower Market where the vivid colours come alive under the fluorescent lights. Other stops include a local market and one of the most beautifully lit temples by night. At night time the streets are alive with food vendors. As we go, we will stop to sample some of the best food in the city. Food is included and the tour has stops at some one of the best local places in town. You will not go hungry so no need to eat beforehand! For most of the tour we will get around by TukTuk and while we can not promise it, we will hopefully encounter very little traffic. TukTuks are fun vehicles and an icon of Bangkok. Tour Starts - 7.00 pm Tour Ends - 11.30 pm (You are welcome to carry on through the night and enjoy the diverse nightlife!) A licensed tour guide will accompany you throughout the trip.
strTitle: Bangkok Night Lights Tuk Tuk Tour

strIntroduction: ITINERARY (Approx) 6.00 - 6.30 AM - Pick-up from central hotels in Bangkok 7.00 AM - Depart Bangkok for Rachaburi Province 8.30 AM - Arrive & depart boat pier to Floating Market by long-tail speed boat 9.00 AM - Arrive the floating market, almost untouched by the modern world. Enjoy watching the farmers selling food, fruits, flowers and many kinds of local products in their boats. 11.30 AM - Visit the handicraft home industry 12.00 PM - Depart to Bangkok 14.00 PM - Drop-off at hotel. ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE Venice is known for its iconic water canals and floating communities, but it is Thailand that truly captures the vibrant charm of a floating market. This might come as a surprise, but before Thailand’s facade is skyscraper-abundant and known worldwide for its street food and shopping scene, it was a city that resided above water. The allure of floating markets is undoubtedly its waterborne businesses - from daily groceries to handmade gifts and snacks. Though many of the extensive canals are now filled up to build roads and buildings, you still can catch a glimpse of that old-school magic at the Damnoen Saduak Floating Market. Before you enter the market, you’ll be introduced to Thailand’s homely culture and traditions at the ‘Gardener’s House’, where you’ll be shown the intricate process of making coconut sugar. From husking the tough coconut shells to extracting the milk and actually processing the granules, be enthralled by the intricate and aromatic process of creating coconut sugar. If you’re lucky, you might just get to taste some of that sweet results. But be warned, you might never want to go back to the normal cane sugar again. Back on the boat, you’ll be whisked away to the main part of the tour: the floating market. You’ll know when you’ve reached - hundreds of boats in all shapes and sizes taking up the water district and locals in their iconic conical hats. It is here you’ll step into the time warp and be transported to a more bucolic era, where a bustling community thrives. If you think the long tail boats only sell everyday produce and novel trinkets, prepare to have your standards redefined. At the marketplace, snacks of all sorts are available - from the famed mango sticky rice to other local delicacies, keep a lookout for vendors who have a traditional charcoal stove preparing piping hot signatures right on the boat. If you’re a bona fide foodie, snag some fresh produce to snack on when you’re back on dry land. For the shopaholics, there’s every reason to embark on this tour as well. There are plenty of vendors selling clothes and fabric of exquisite quality, showcasing the standards locally produced goods. Whether it’s everyday wear or more traditional outfits, there’s bound to be a boat selling exactly what you want. And if you’re feeling exceptionally touristy, you’ll be able to be a boat selling ‘I LOVE THAILAND’ t-shirts. While you're at the floating market, you'll get to witness firsthand the kind hospitality of the locals and their skills on being able to prepare food, sell items and controlling the boat all at the same time. If you're planning to make a purchase, don't be afraid to engage in a friendly banter with the locals and bargain for a cheaper deal. You'll come to realise how much more fun and immersive the overall experience is, for there's no better way to be one with another culture other than communicating with them. ************************************************************************************************ PRIVATE TOUR OPTION To enjoy this itinerary with the comfort of a private vehicle and guide, please book the 'Private Tour Option' on the booking page. A private tour not only allows the luxury of being picked up and dropped off to anywhere in Bangkok, but the timings are more flexible too! **Important** - For private tours, the minimum number of people joining is 2 Pax. Every Additional person after 2 Pax is only 900 THB per person. Please note the price differences after referring to our options on the booking page when selecting your preferred type of tour. ************************************************************************************************ THE GUIDE The tour comes with an English speaking guide, who'll give you insider information on all the things you need to know about this exotic attraction. The best part of the Damnoen Saduak Floating Market Day Tour is the flexibility of the itinerary. Should you want to get more personal with the local folks, you could arrange to alight the boat and walk by the side pavements for an alternative experience. ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Damnoen Saduak Floating Market Bangkok Tour at Ratchaburi

strIntroduction: THE BRIDGE ON THE RIVER KWAI An icon of WWII in South East Asia, the Bridge on River Kwai is not just a symbol of the hardships and devastating aspects of the Japanese Occupation, but of the sheer mettle and strength of the allied POWs as they withstood the adverse conditions of physical and mental torture inflicted on them throughout the building of the bridge. Also referred to as 'the Death Railway', it is said that one life was lost for each sleeper laid on the track. ************************************************************************************************ THE HISTORIC ROUTE The guided tour will take you through the historic route of southern Thailand to Burma, the very same one taken by the POW slave laborers as they trudged through torture and hunger to build the railway. The Bridge on River Kwai was constructed to transport cargo daily to India, to back up the Imperial Japanese Army's planned attack on India. Our guides are local experts, and are sure to provide you with impressive and essential insights so that you can make the most out of your trip here. ************************************************************************************************ THE JEATH WAR MUSEUM & WAR CEMETERY The tour begins with a visit to the Kanchanaburi War Cemetery and the JEATH museum - which stands for Japan, England, Australia, Thailand and Holland, the countries involved the building of the railway - to immerse yourself in the history and background of the Death Railway for a better understanding and appreciation of the trip. Be moved by replicas of the notorious living conditions and actual items from the site. ********************************************************************************************** RIDE THE DEATH RAILWAY & VISIT KRASEA CAVE Enter an abyss of natural vegetation as you take the train ride on the Death Railway. Entering the jungle will bring you on a surreal route on the actual bridge and the original arches built by the POWs, a real thrill to be in such close physical proximity of such an iconic fixture of World War 2. Bid adieu to the end of your tour from the tracks as you watch a technicolour sunset on the horizon. After that, take a short trip to atmospheric Krasea Cave to sight a Buddha statue. ********************************************************************************************** LUNCH An authentic Thai lunch is included in this tour. Savour the flavours as your surrounded by amazing scenery! ********************************************************************************************** PICK UP TIME (From Major Hotels in Bangkok) 6.15 AM (Approx) ********************************************************************************************** PRIVATE TOUR OPTION To enjoy this itinerary with the comfort of a private vehicle and guide, please book the 'Private Tour Option' on the booking page. A private tour not only allows the luxury of being picked up and dropped off to anywhere in Bangkok, but the timings are more flexible too! **********************************************************************************************
strTitle: The Bridge on the River Kwai & JEATH War Museum - 1 Day Tour

strIntroduction: PICK UP & DROP OFF TIMING Pick up around 7:00 AM to 7:30 AM in the Night Bazaar and Old City area. If your hotel is within 3 km outside of the Old City then pickup will be between 7:30 AM and 7:45 AM. Drop off - 9.00 PM at your hotel (Approx) ITINERARY 9:00 - Arrive at a natural hot spring in Chiang Rai (approximately 20 minutes) 11:00 - White Temple + Black House (approximately 1 hr/30 minutes) 1:30 - Lunch at a restaurant near the Golden Triangle (approximately 45 minutes) 2:00 - Golden Triangle viewpoint at the border of Thailand, Laos, and Myanmar (about 1 hour) *Optional tour - River boat tour of the Mekong River to the Don Sao Island 3:30 PM - Mae Sai at the Burmese-Thai border (approximately 40 minutes) 4:45 PM - Akha hill tribe village (about 30-40 minutes) *Optional Tour - Long Neck Karen hill tribe village 6:00 PM - Depart from Chiang Rai then stop along the way at a gas station 9:00 PM - Return to your hotel in Chiang Mai Note: The above is an approximate itinerary. We do our best so everyone can completely enjoy each site of the tour. Some of the timing in the schedule could be altered slightly by weather, traffic, and the number of tourists at the sites. ******************************************************************************************** CHIANG MAI GOLDEN TRIANGLE TOUR Sights Covered : - White Temple - Black House - Golden Triangle Your Chiang Mai Golden Triangle Tour begins with an early morning pickup in our air conditioned mini bus which will be your traveling home for the day. The fascinating all day tour will include traveling to Chiang Rai where we will be touring the White Temple also known as Wat Rong Khun. Once we complete touring the beautiful White Temple we will, stop by the magnificent and unique Black House. After that, we travel further north to the Golden Triangle area. Before seeing the Golden Triangle we will enjoy a lunch buffet at a Thai restaurant. Once lunch is complete we will proceed to the Golden Triangle viewpoint where we will see Laos, Myanmar, and Thailand come together. At this location we can see the Mekong and Krok Rivers along the border of these three countries. Continuing on we will go to a popular Thai-Myanmar border crossing and visit the Mae Sai market. Mae Sai is Thailand’s northern most city. At the Mae Sai market there are many minority products available. This is the place for you if you are a tourist good at negotiating prices. Wrapping up the tour north we will travel from the Mae Sai market to an Akha hill tribe village. The Akha hill tribe village women are well known for the headdresses they wear along with other spectacular clothing. We get to see what their homes look like (at least from the outside), crafts being made, and various products sold in the village. Our professional tour guide will be with your throughout the day to explain the historical and cultural significance of each stop as well as answer any questions you may have during our day together in northern Thailand. The tour ends with a return trip to Chiang Mai where we began our day together. *Add on to be paid in cash* - One-hour boat trip along the Mekong River to the Laotian market on Don Sao Island for an additional 330 baht per person (the boat ride costs 300 baht per person and the entrance fee into Laos is 30 baht per person). Be sure to bring your passport. Please speak with your tour guide about arranging this extra trip. ******************************************************************************************** ALTERNATIVE ITINERARIES There are two alternative yet similar itineraries you may enjoy with us. Sights Covered : - Golden Triangle - White Temple - Black House - Karen Long Neck Tribe White Temple + Black House , Karen Long Neck and Golden Triangle Tour This is a very similar tour as the one mentioned in detail above but will include a visit to a Karen Long Neck tribe as well as the Akha tribe. Both tribes have very unique dress. The Karen villagers are famous for their long necks. In these villages you will be sure to find handmade crafts for purchase as a souvenir of this wonderful trip. This tour will also finish at your pick up point at around 9:00 PM. ******************************************************************************************** WHITE TEMPLE & BLACK HOUSE TOUR (NO GOLDEN TRIANGLE) - White Temple - Black House This tour involves visiting the White Temple; however, instead of heading further north to see the Golden Triangle and the ethnic tribes we will stay in the Chiang Rai area and go to the tourist site known as the Black House. The Black House may be scary for some but fascinating to others. The Black House decorated in a “dark art” style is the opposite of the White Temple. The contrasts of the two sites are striking. In the Black House we will see skeletons, animal fur, and a dungeon with torture like instruments. This tour involves much less driving and ends sooner than the Golden Triangle tour. The end of the tour will be around 6:30 PM when you arrive back safely at your pick up location from earlier in the day.
strTitle: Chiang Mai Golden Triangle Tour - Opt. Karen Long Neck Tribe

strIntroduction: CHIANG MAI CITY & TEMPLE TOUR ******************************************************************************************** PICK UP & DROP OFF TIMES Pick up Morning Tour : 8.30 AM Drop off Morning Tour : 12.00 PM Pick up Afternoon Tour : 1.00 PM Drop off Afternoon Tour : 5.00 PM ******************************************************************************************** WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE Delve into Chiang Mai’s rich royal history and Buddhist culture on this inspirational journey back in time. This enlightening half-day Chiang Mai temple tour explores the mystique behind four of the city’s most captivating temples - Wat Phra Singh, Wat Chedi Luang, Wat Chiang Mun and Wat Suan Dok. Each of these temples offers more than half a millennium of colourful history. On this Chiang Mai city tour you will see priceless artefacts and dramatic architecture. Glimpse Chiang Mai’s holiest relic, the ‘Lion Buddha’ at Wat Phra Singh and lead yourself along the path to enlightenment in the beautiful grounds of Wat Suan Dok. Aided by a knowledgeable local guide, you will learn about the unique teachings and rituals of the Buddhist faith. It is one of the most flexible Chiang Mai day tours, offering a choice of morning or afternoon departures every day to effortlessly escape the crowds. ******************************************************************************************** WAT PHRA SINGH Wat Phra Singh is the most venerated temple in the city and dates back to the mid-14th century. Taking pride of place is Chiang Mai’s holiest relic, the Phra Singh or ‘Lion Buddha.’ It is housed in a classic three-tiered gilded temple displaying remarkable artistic features. It is arguably the most photogenic in the old city with intricate gilded teak and rich ornamental decoration throughout. The red and gold leaf lacquered walls are covered in fascinating murals depicted captivating scenes of local life. The temple grounds itself are expansive featuring a series of ‘chedis’ including one housing the monastic library. The fully functioning monastery houses about 700 monks and is a prominent pilgrimage spot for devotees. This is especially true during the Songkran festival when the Phra Singh Buddha is carefully raised onto a gilded chariot and paraded through the streets of old Chiang Mai. ******************************************************************************************** WAT CHEDI LUANG Just a stroll away, Wat Chedi Luang offers a startling contrast to Wat Phra Singh. As the name suggests (‘Luang’ meaning large) it’s a huge red stone ruined Lanna-style temple quite unlike anything else in the city. A 16th century earthquake purportedly toppled part of its tall spire but it still stands a commanding 60 metres high. The interior is reached via a monumental stairway where fearsome looking serpent statues stand guard. Despite its ruined state it is still a place of worship and there are several Buddhist shrines within. In its prime the temple housed Thailand’s most revered idol, the Emerald Buddha for nearly a century before it was eventually relocated to Bangkok. A jade reproduction of it was commissioned to celebrate Wat Chedi Luang’s 600th anniversary and sits in one of the niches of the chedi. There are two gilded ‘viharn’ assembly rooms within the grounds both featuring intricate wood carvings. Wat Chedi Luang is also arguably the best spot to engage in monastic conversation as there is a well established program of ‘monk chat’ people-to-people exchanges. ******************************************************************************************** WAT CHIANG MUN Wat Chiang Mun is as old as this ancient city itself, built by Chiang Mai’s founding father King Mengrai in 1296. One of the most visually appealing features of the complex is the so-called ‘Elephant Chedi’ which is seemingly built upon the backs of 15 stone elephants beneath a sparkling golden spire. There are two Lanna style viharns, each with typically exuberant carvings. The larger features gilded carvings of Kirtimukha, a fearsome looking horned demon with huge fangs, while the smaller viharn contains two famous Buddha images. This includes the Phra Sae Tang Kamani ‘Crystal Buddha’ which even predates the temple and city itself. Such is its importance a dispute over its possession sparked a war, which is still commemorated annually in Chiang Mai to this day. ******************************************************************************************** WAT SUAN DOK You will also visit the ‘flower garden temple’ of Wat Suan Dok, situated just west of the old walled city. Its alternative name comes from its use as a royal flower garden. The complex is distinctive for its size, filled with numerous small white stucco chedis that contain the ashes of several members of the Lanna Royal family. You will have opportunity to stroll through the beautifully manicured gardens and set against a captivating backdrop of the Doi Suthep Mountain, it is a highly photogenic scene at sunset. The large 48-metre high bell shaped golden pagoda is another appealing highlight that can be glimpsed from many vantage points around the city. The temple grounds also include a Buddhist University which offers monk chat sessions and meditation courses for curious visitors.
strTitle: Chiang Mai Day Tours : Chiang Mai Temple Tour

strIntroduction: THE ANCIENT KINGDOM OF SIAM Visit the famours world heritage UNESCO site of Thailand on this Bangkok to Ayutthaya Historical Park full day tour. Did you know that Ayutthaya was the most populous city in the world during the 1700’s reaching a population of over one million? There is a lot to see and experience on a full day tour to Ayutthaya Historical Park including several famous Wats, the Bang Pa-In Palace, and a cruise along the Chao Phraya! ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE The day begins with an early morning pick-up at one of many Bangkok hotels to a departure point where you will then head north to Ayutthaya with your English speaking guide by air-conditioned transportation. Once your tour group reaches Ayutthaya you will experience the ancient beauty and calm that the famous temples and ruins have in the area by walking the temple grounds and taking memorable photographs! ************************************************************************************************ THE RUINS & TEMPLES This tour takes you back in time when Ayutthaya was the capital of Siam and when Thailand was under a different name. Walk the grounds of the famous Wats in the area including Wat Yai Chai Mongkol and Wat Mahathat. During the morning hours you have the opportunity to appreciate the architecture that has survived hundreds of years and the war with the Burmese more than a couple of hundred years ago. Definitely a sight not to miss would be the famous Buddha head surrounded by tree roots at Wat Mahathat. ************************************************************************************************ BANG PA-IN SUMMER PALACE You will also be treated to see the summer palace of King Rama IV walking the beautiful grounds of the Bang Pa-In Summer Palace. There are several buildings with unique exquisite architecture as well. ************************************************************************************************ AYUTTHAYA RIVER CRUISE After eating a delicious and authentic Thai lunch, you will leave land and *join a river cruise that will take you on a picturesque cruise on the Chao Phraya River all the way back to Bangkok (53 miles)*. On the river cruise while contemplating the significance of the day in Ayutthaya you will be treated to the sites of many temples along the riverside all the way back to Bangkok. During the river cruise back to Bangkok you will notice that the river is busy with traffic similar to Bangkok roadways but on the river it is river buses, longtails, and cross-river ferries all sharing the river way! This can be quiet a unique sigh in itself. Finally, you will also pass under many major significant bridges that connect one part of Bangkok with another on your way back to the morning departure point. *NOTE - You have the option to take the River Cruise from Bangkok to Ayutthaya too and return by Coach, should you prefer that route. Please inform when booking. ************************************************************************************************ OTHER OPTIONS For guests who are not interested in a cruise but would rather travel both ways by car, or would like a private tour instead of a join-in tour, we have a range of options to choose from to suit your needs - - Ayutthaya Tour - No Cruise & Long-tail Boat Ride - Roundtrip - transport by Car Only - Ayutthaya Tour including Long-tail Boat Ride (No Cruise) - Roundtrip - transport by Car Only **Private versions of all types of tours available. For private tours, the minimum number of people joining is 2 Pax.** Please note the price differences after referring to our options on the booking page when selecting your preferred type of tour. ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP + DROP OFF TIME - (From Central Hotels in Bangkok) Pick- up - 6.30 AM (Approx - Will be confirmed once booked) Drop off - 5.00 (Approx) ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Bangkok to Ayutthaya Historical Park Full Day Tour + Cruise

strIntroduction: WHITE WATER RAFTING ON MAE TAENG RIVER, CHIANG MAI Brief Itinerary (Approx) : 8.30 - 9.30 AM - Pick up from Chiang Mai 09.30-11.30 am - Drive to Mae Taeng 12. 00 PM - 4 PM - Lunch + white water rafting briefing & activity 04.00 pm. -05.00 pm - Arrive at ATV Camp for guests who booked option 2. 05.00 pm.-06.00 pm - Drop off at your hotel in Chiang Mai In the mood for some no-holds barred action? This Chiang Mai rafting expedition pits you and a group of fellow adrenaline-junkies against some of the best white water in Thailand, ranging through rapids ranked from Class 2 - 4, amid spectacularly beautiful scenery. Accompanied by professional instructors, you’ll learn how to control and manoeuvre a raft in both calm and rough waters, before taking off on an adventure where you’ll need all your courage and skill. As if that wasn’t enough, you can also choose a combo tour which includes a heart-pounding ATV-riding session along pristine mountain trails. The fun starts early, with a pick-up from your Chiang Mai accommodation by air-conditioned vehicle. Meet your fellow rafters and guides, then head off through scenic countryside, past unspoilt hill-tribe villages, to the fast-flowing Mae Taeng River. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OPTION 1 - WHITE WATER RAFTING (10 KM) On reaching the river, you’ll be served a delicious traditional Thai lunch for a vital energy boost. Then, it’s straight into training - these are big rapids, especially during the rainy season, which runs from August to October and ensures that the Mae Taeng is moving fast. Full equipment, including life jacket, helmet and boots, is provided, and meets international safety standards. Before even entering the river, you’ll be taught the basics of safety on the water, how to paddle and steer the raft, and what to do if you take an unexpected dip (you need to be able to swim for this activity!) Launching into the Mae Taeng, it’s easygoing for the first mile or so to break you in gently. Bask in the sunshine, and enjoy sublime views of tree-lined mountains, terraced rice fields and the occasional waterfall. Your guides will keep you practising your paddling and turns, because before long the first patch of rapids will be on the horizon. This is among the most challenging of extreme sports, and with white water rafting in Chiang Mai, they don’t play around. Your nerves and abilities will be tested to the limit as you navigate around rocks and through foaming currents. You’ll need to pull together as a team to avoid flipping the raft and going for a swim. Don’t think it’s all hard work though - expect a day of serious fun out on the river. Between rapids you’ll be paddling gently through a lush jungle paradise, between the towering walls of winding gorges, with wildlife chattering all around. Plenty of time to get your breath back and snap a few photos before you’re back in the heat of the action. Arriving at the destination 10 kilometres downriver, you’ll be greeted with hot coffee and showers. Celebrate your victory with paddles raised in the air - you’ve just conquered one of the most extreme sets of rapids in Thailand. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OPTION 2 - WHITE WATER RAFTING (10KM) + ATV 250CC (30 MIN) Of course, for some people, just a single burst of action in one day isn’t quite enough. If that’s you, then why not combine your rafting tour with some fun ATV riding as well? The itinerary is virtually the same as Option 1, but after a short cool-down from the rafting, you’ll be given a lesson in how to operate and steer a powerful ATV. Then, mount up for an extreme journey, following your guide along mountain paths and through thick jungle. That’s right - the stunning scenery you were admiring from your raft? You now get to ride through it, revving your engine and whipping up clouds of dust, splashing through huge puddles if it’s rainy season. Whether you take Option 1 or Option 2, expect to get wet, muddy and fully tired out. Many guests fall sound asleep on the way back to the city despite the bumpy roads! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- WHY YOU SHOULD TAKE THIS TOUR Chiang Mai is a beautiful city, famous for its architecture and cultural activities. Sometimes though, you just need to escape the urban environment and get some action-packed adventure. This rafting tour is without doubt the most exhilarating fun you can have in the Chiang Mai area. See some of the most beautiful scenery in northern Thailand, in between bouts of adrenaline-fuelled paddling. You’ll get wet, but you’ll soon dry out, especially if you whip off on an ATV straight afterwards. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
strTitle: 10% OFF White Water Rafting Chiang Mai on Mae Taeng River

strIntroduction: In between, pedal-power and long tail boats will bring us into a world of fascination far removed from central Bangkok and traditional tourist sites. On this tour, we will see scintillating beauty combined with amazing contrasts: modern lifestyles derived from classic traditions, Buddhist temples coexisting harmoniously with Muslim mosques, and frenetic urban sprawl giving way to gentle rural landscapes. Most importantly, you will see the many faces of Bangkok and in a way that you will not forget. ************************************************************************************************ WHAT OUR DAY MAY LOOK LIKE - *Please note - this is just a general itinerary. We may deviate from this on the day depending on the conditions on the day* From the meeting point, we start shortly by exploring the bustling everyday life of Chinatown. Through narrow alleyways and winding pathways best accessed through two-wheel transport, we pass an engineering area, markets, local temples, and a vast array of unique “street life”. [45 minutes - 1 hour]. Aboard train at 10.10 am. At Bangkok’s train station we load our bikes and hop aboard the local train and a 30 km train-ride will bring us to a local area in the Eastern part of Bangkok. [1 hour in train and preparing to cycle again.] After disembarking from the train, we cycling along miles of paths along the beautiful klongs and local neighbourhoods. Modern mansions next to traditional wooden houses on stilts. Rice paddies, magnificent green vistas and fishing pounds and plantations. [2.5 hours] Following a local meal (1 hour) in this area we will continue exploring and will make a stop at a local temple (1.5 hour) before we take the long-tail boat to experience the peaceful life along the canals. [45 minutes] It’s now time to get back towards the office. A little bit of cycling (15 minutes) will bring the tour to the BTS station which we take our bikes on to head back to the big city. [40 Minutes BTS Journey] Cycling from the BTS station to the office will allow us to savour and experience urban Bangkok and/or more local of its enchanting, local neighbourhoods. [20 minutes] ************************************************************************************************ ITINERARY Tour time: 09:00 - 18:00 09.00 Meet-up at our office - right behind River City Pier for a briefing of the tour. 09.15 Select bicycles. 09.30 Departure through a unique part of Chinatown (3 km). 10.20 First train ride (30 km). 11.00-13.00 - Cycling: Unique, varied and relaxed. No tourist to be seen here. 13.00-14.00 - Sumptuous locale lunch. Take it easy and relax. We've got plenty of time. Walk around, there is much be be seen here. 14.00-15.00 - Again on the bike. For a visit of the amazing "Disco" temple. (5 to 8 km) 15.00-15.45 - Long-tail boat through a unique klong, changing into a minor river and a market. (15 km) 16.15-17.00 - BTS Skytrain, What a contrast. Completely different from earlier. You float above urban Bangkok. (15 km) 17.00-18.00 - Last leg of the tour is again totally different. We cycle through narrow alleys back to the Grand China Princess hotel. In total, we will travel about 100KM. The actual cycling is about 40 km. What you see will amaze you. ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: The Ultimate Bangkok Bicycle & Boat Tour: Ride. Eat. Drink.

strIntroduction: CRUISE SCHEDULE Grand Pearl Dinner Cruise runs 7 days a week. Start time : 7.30 PM End time : 9.30 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- GRAND PEARL CRUISE Step aboard the famous Grand Pearl River Cruise for a truly unforgettable voyage along the Chao Phraya River. Often known as the ‘River of Kings,’ the Chao Phraya offers stunning views of many iconic Bangkok landmarks, from temples and palaces to luxury hotels and sweeping bridges. As you cruise along beneath a canopy of stars, admiring the idyllic scenery on both sides of the river, you’ll be wined and dined beyond compare. This must-do package features a sumptuous banquet, spiced up with traditional Thai music and dance accompaniment. There are many excellent sightseeing tours in Bangkok, but very few can hope to capture the city’s beauty as well as the Grand Pearl River Cruise. Unmissable Bangkok sights are lit up to stunning effect, while the elegant ship, attentive crew, superb buffet feast and first-class live entertainment combine to create a unique, deeply romantic experience. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- THE JOURNEY & MEAL Your cruise departs in the evening from the River City Pier, where you’ll be ceremoniously welcomed aboard with a smile and a fresh, fruity cocktail. As live jazz music plays, the ship heads upriver, passing a string of world-class waterfront hotels, followed by Wat Arun (the Temple of Dawn) and the Grand Palace, then the legendary Wat Phra Kaew (the Temple of the Golden Buddha). These and many other sights are beautifully illuminated at night, making for a sensational backdrop, so do bring a camera. Look out also for scenes of everyday riverside communities that give an authentic view of life by the sides of the Chao Phraya. Returning to the brightly-lit pier, a delicious buffet of local and international delicacies is unveiled. Indulge in a mouthwatering feast, as well as a popular ‘sushi corner,’ that you can enjoy either in the air-conditioned restaurant with live entertainment, or on the upper deck, cooled by the river breeze. Musical performances, dance routines and even a masked play create a truly enthralling atmosphere. Wine sourced from some of the world’s finest vineyards can be ordered from the onboard bar. The Chao Phraya Dinner Cruise by Grand Pearl is without question one of the highlights of any stay in Bangkok - an unmissable evening sightseeing tour that is as romantic as it is luxurious. This is the best, most relaxing way to see some of the city’s best-known landmarks, complimented by a sensational banquet. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- WHAT YOU'LL SEE There is plenty of scope to catch some beautiful photographs during this cruise. The ship travels slowly, allowing you time to catch just the right angle, or pose for a memorable selfie! Many of Bangkok’s landmarks are lit up overnight, making them instantly recognisable. Just a few of the sights along the way include: - Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn) - Grand Palace - Wat Phra Kaew (Temple of the Golden Buddha) - - Bang Khun Prom Palace - Rama Vii Bridge - Wichai Prasit Fort --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- TRANSPORT ADD - ON Return transport by air-conditioned van is available from central areas of Bangkok only. You can book this add-on on the payment page. Pick-up time (Approx) : 6.00 PM Drop-off time : 10.30 PM ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
strTitle: 10% OFF Dinner Cruise Bangkok by Grand Pearl Cruise

strIntroduction: HALF DAY TOUR For 150 years, the Grand Palace Bangkok has served as the home of Thailand’s kings and the administrative seat of the government. Today, this regal complex is one of Thailand’s most iconic attractions. Join this, 3 hour, efficient yet detailed, half-day guided tour and let your guide enchant you with stories from the past. Skip the queues and head for the royal reception halls, which house an antique throne and a European style reception room. Marvel at the intricate details in the buildings’ architecture, which blends European and local influences. Learn about the palace’s restoration in Dusit Hall, which doubles as a museum for history buffs. Wander through the very same buildings that Thailand’s royalty used to traverse, such as the Royal Funeral Hall and Royal Coronation Hall. The highlight of this tour is the Emerald Buddha, housed in Wat Phra Kaew, the holiest building in the complex. This small, yet highly revered statue was carved from a single piece of jade and in the meditating position in the style of North Thailand’s Lanna School. Conclude your tour at Gems Gallery, home to Thailand’s most ravishing jewellery, whereupon you will be taken back to the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP + DROP TIMES (From Central Hotels in Bangkok - Confirm upon Booking) Morning Tour - 7.15 AM (Approx) Afternoon Tour - 12.30 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Grand Palace Bangkok and Wat Phra Kaew Half Day Tour

strIntroduction: PRIVATE SPEED BOAT TOUR FROM PHUKET Embark on a true island hopping experience from Phuket from the comfort of your own private speed boat. Enjoy a day to savour amid the astonishing tropical scenery of the famed Phi Phi Islands or cruise the secluded bay and lagoons of Phang Nga Bay including a visit to the legendary James Bond Island. With private boat tours you can experience the day your way. No more waiting for other guests during early morning hotel pick-ups. You have utmost flexibility to depart on your adventure at a time to suit you and can even request another tour or revise the itinerary. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- RECOMMENDED ITINERARIES *Note - (Depending on the tide and how crowded it is, our sights or itinerary may slightly alter - This is to ensure the best tour possible for our guests) Timings are also flexible to a certain degree. Please inform us when booking. PHI PHI ISLANDS + BAMBOO ISLAND Pick - up : 7.30 AM (Approx) Drop - off : 5.30 PM (Approx) Maya Bay Monkey Beach Viking Cave Pileh Lagoon Loh Sama Bida Island Nui Bay (Snorkeling spots) Bamboo Island The legendary Phi Phi islands, invitingly close to Phuket, are widely considered to be the jewels of the Andaman Sea. Visitors can explore sheltered bays of dazzling white sand, framed by imposing limestone cliffs. The clear, calm waters are a snorkeler’s dream with abundant marine life hiding out within the vibrant coral reefs. The trip begins at Maya Bay, deservedly lauded for its outstanding Instagram-perfect scenery. It has gained prominence as the setting for the Leonardo DiCaprio film ‘The Beach’ and features soft white sands amid eye catching limestone peaks. After a spot of snorkelling on the reef and relaxation on the sand, venture inland along jungle trails for encounters with tropical birdlife. Monkey Beach is another highlight of this private boat tour to Phi Phi. The beach is stunning and you get up close and personal with a colony of mischievous primates who call this stretch of paradise home. After a stop at the famous Viking Cove, enjoy a freshly prepared lunch amid exquisite tropical scenery on Bamboo Island. Savour a delicious Thai spread on one of the islands’ most striking tropical beaches. There is ample opportunity to further explore the incredible reefs of Phi Phi with time for snorkeling on majestic Mosquito Island, Loh Samah or Nui Bay. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- PHI PHI ISLANDS + KHAI ISLAND Sights Covered Maya Bay Monkey Beach Viking Cave Pileh Lagoon Loh Sama Bida Island Nui Bay (Snorkeling spots) Khai Nok Island Pick - up : 7.30 AM (Approx) Drop - off : 5.30 PM (Approx) You may choose a slightly different option for your Phi Phi private boat tour itinerary with an alternative visit to the tiny tropical paradise of Koh Khai Nok. This island may be small in stature but is big on the wow factor. The sand is fine and white and the waters are indigo-blue, teaming with tropical fish. The snorkelling here is superb while the scenery above the water line will also take the breath away. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- JAMES BOND ISLAND & PHANG NGA BAY Pick - up : 7.30 AM (Approx) Drop - off : 5.30 PM (Approx) Sights Covered Phang Nga Bay James Bond Island Panak Island Hong Island Panyee Village Naka Island Leaving the bright lights of cosmopolitan Phuket, a whole new world of discovery awaits on a private boat tour around Phang Nga Bay. This unhurried tour allows you to experience a day kayaking through mangrove swamps and stunning turquoise lagoons whilst admiring dramatic limestone karsts jutting out of the serene waters. You will visit Khao Phing Kan, famously dubbed James Bond Island. There is opportunity to get all the photographs you require of this iconic sight before gliding through the breathtaking lagoons and caves of Panak and Hong Islands. Then take to the water in a more intimate fashion with a tour by kayak through calm mangrove forests. Next stop is Panyee Village for a Thai buffet lunch (as an add-on), with time to fully explore this traditional community of stilted village houses. Before returning to Phuket, a final stop takes you to Naka Island where you can enjoy time swimming in clear, uncrowded waters. It’s a day like no other. A tour exploring a breathtaking natural environment in style with all the flexibility and added comforts of a private excursion, tailored to your own needs. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- CUSTOM ITINERARY Already have an itinerary planned or are looking for somewhere specific to go? Please inform us and we'll offer you a customised quote and make it happen for you! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OUR SPEED BOATS Boat 1 - Max - 18 Pax (2 Engines) Boat 2 - Max - 30 Pax (2 Engines) The vessels are made to exacting standards providing utmost space and comfort aboard, with an uncompromising level of safety. Passenger safety is the number one priority, with modern regularly serviced equipment that meets all required standards. Each Phuket boat charter is fully equipped with all the facilities needed for a great day out, including high quality snorkeling gear for all guests. Boats have life jackets in a variety sizes, emergency first aid kits and insurance is included. For larger groups, please inquire for the following boats - Boat 3 - Max - 40 Pax (3 Engines) Boat 4 - Max - 45 Pax (3 Engines) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- RECOMMENDED ADD - ONS Private English Speaking Guide Lunch National Park Fees (Option to pay as an add-on or on the spot in cash) Private Van Pick-up (If applicable) Kayak (For James Bond Island & Phang Nga Bay Trip) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- PICK UP & DROP OFF LOCATIONS & TIMINGS Pick - up : 7.30 AM (Approx) Drop - off : 5.30 PM (Approx) Pick-up included by air-conditioned van from any hotel from the following locations : Patong - Kata - Karon All other locations need a private transport add-on booked at 1200 THB per van (up to 14 Pax). You can book this add-on on the payment page. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
strTitle: 10% OFF Private Speed Boat Tour Phuket - Perfect for Groups!

strIntroduction: The Sompong Thai Cooking School is one of the best places to take a Thai cooking class during your stay in Bangkok. The cooking classes are available 7 days a week with a set menu that varies depending on the day of the week you take the class : We really do offer awesome value for quality and are located bang in the middle of the city! ************************************************************************************************ SHOPPING AT THE LOCAL MARKET Once you arrive at Sompong Thai Cooking School, the cooking class begins as you are taken to a local market to select various fresh ingredients you will be using during the cooking session. Our expert cooking staff will explain about fruits and vegetables found at the market as well as which ones are best for purchase. This is a great time to ask questions as well as getting to know the other cooking participants! Our wonderful staff does a great job during each class to create a positive experience for everyone involved, no matter how much cooking experience each participant has. TIME TO COOK AMAZING FOOD Once the food has been selected at the market, everyone will return to Somphong Thai Cooking School to put on their aprons and get ready to learn to make a super Thai meal. Led by a head chef and two wonderful assistants, the actual cooking session begins as the fun experience continues. While preparing to start receiving instructions you will notice that there is a clean cooking station waiting for you to call your own. It will become clear now that you didn’t pay for this tour to just watch a chef cook - but to actually cut, grind, fry, slice, and dice your way to preparing a truly healthy, delicious and most importantly authentic, Thai meal! One of the great parts of this cooking class are our expert instructors explaining each detail of the cooking process, so that all individuals can understand and enjoy. Participants are encouraged to take from it as much knowledge as they can -so questions and comments are always appreciated by our staff! While cooking takes place our staff will teach a little Thai culture and explain how it is relevant during the cooking course. Of course, by the time the meal is completed and served it doesn’t only look delicious but professionally prepared as well. THE MEAL After each participant has completed preparing their meal, everyone sits down together to eat the five course Thai cuisine that each prepared under professional, entertaining instructions. You will find it amazing how good the meal and conversation is with your fellow participants! You'll even be offered a complimentary recipe book to bring back home with you so that you can repeat your feats of the day! ************************************************************************************************ THE MENUS • Monday – Chicken green curry, Homemade green curry paste, Stir fried chicken with cashew nut, Thai spicy mixed fruits salad, and Egg custard in pumpkin • Tuesday – Chuu chee curry with prawns, Homemade red curry paste, Chicken galangal in coconut milk soup, Pomelo salad, and Mango with sticky rice • Wednesday – Panaeng chicken salad, Homemade panaeng curry paste, Thai papaya salad, Fried noodle Thai style, and Golden banana in syrup • Thursday – Chicken yellow curry, Homemade yellow curry paste, Spicy prawns with lemongrass salad, Fried noodle with soya sauce with chicken, and Mango with sticky rice • Friday – Chicken massaman curry, Homemade massaman curry paste, Chicken fried rice, Spicy prawns soup, and Golden pumpkin in coconut soup • Saturday – Prawns curry with pineapples, Homemade red curry paste, Stir fried spicy chicken, Spicy Thai omelet with herbs salad, and Mango with sticky rice • Sunday – Chicken red curry, Homemade red curry paste, Stir fried pawns with tamarind, Northern chicken spicy salad, and Mango with sticky rice **Note : Vegetarian and Halal Options Available** Although there is no set Vegetarian or Halal Menu, please inform us of your requirements and our chefs will prepare the appropriate ingredients for you! ************************************************************************************************ CLASS SCHEDULE & TIME Mon- Sun Morning Class : 9.30 AM to 1.30 PM Afternoon Class : 2.30 PM to 6 PM ************************************************************************************************ PICK - UP (only from BTS Chong Nonsi Station) BTS-Chong Nonsi Station ( Exit no. 3 ) 9.00 am for Morning class, 2.45 pm for Afternoon class ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Somphong Thai Cooking School - Cooking Class in Bangkok

strIntroduction: Thailand’s traditional markets are legendary and offer an immersive, unforgettable glimpse of local life away from the buzz of the big city. A trip to a Thai market is an experience to savour in every sense - combining the two great passions of shopping and eating. The commercial buzz of a traditional Thai market is truly an adventure not to be missed. The loud, animated atmosphere, rich aromas and colourful exotic produce add up to a multi-sensory journey through Thailand’s rural heartland. ************************************************************************************************ YOUR DAY The Amphawa Floating Market Tour and visit to Maeklong Railway Market offers double the delight with two very distinctive Thai market experiences. These are arguably the two most unique traditional markets in Thailand. Located within easy reach of central Bangkok, Amphawa Floating Market and Train Market Bangkok are in Samut Songkhram region, an area noted for its photogenic salt fields, rural beauty and authentic Thai way of life. The tour also includes a leisurely evening canal cruise to gaze at the region’s famed fireflies as they light up the night sky. ITINERARY 11.30 Bangkok Hotel pickup 12.30 Depart for Samut Songkhram province 14.30 Arrive at Maeklong Railway Market 15.30 Drive to Amphawa Floating Market 18.30 Canal cruise 19.00 Depart for Bangkok 20.45 Return to hotel ************************************************************************************************ AMPHAWA FLOATING MARKET The noisy, photogenic Amphawa Floating Market Tour is a quintessential Thai experience featuring wooden boats overflowing with ready to eat food and tropical produce alongside old charming teak shophouses selling exotic snacks, handicrafts and souvenirs. Sample fried sea mussels, prawns, steaming noodles, exotic fruits, cakes and much more as you stroll around the warren of waterfront stalls or hop on a boat and cruise along the canal. The quintessential Floating Market Bangkok image of smiling ladies in big hats serving up spicy bowls of food on the water is one of those fascinating photo opportunities that makes a visit so special. It is a much more authentic experience than other Thai floating markets where fruit and seafood is picked and caught locally, and even the colourful handicrafts for sale in the market are handmade by local artisans. As you stroll around, you will also be greeted by local homeowners who live right on the canal banks. As darkness falls, the unmistakable aroma of sizzling grilled seafood permeates the air and the canal banks are illuminated with twinkling lights. ************************************************************************************************ MAEKLONG RAILWAY MARKET A visit to Maeklong Railway Market is quite probably the most quirky market experience you will ever have. It is also known as the ‘Risky Market’ – for good reason. At first sight it resembles any other bustling Thai market with stalls brimming with exotic produce such as durian and mango, aromatic spices, herbs and seafood. Only when strolling around the stalls will you notice the train tracks directly underneath your feet. Several times a day the blast of a train horn in the distance signals a flurry of furious activity. Marvel as Train Market Bangkok stallholders quickly whip away their produce out of the train’s path. The train then trundles through the market just inches from stall awnings and produce stacked high at the edge of the tracks. Once the train is gone, it’s business as usual again at this Railway Market Bangkok. This unique activity takes place several times a day and only adds to what is a unique market experience like no other. ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Amphawa Floating Market Bangkok & Maeklong Train Market Tour

strIntroduction: Authentic Thai cuisine and raving hospitality makes Thailand truly the land of smiles. At the Chao Phraya River Cruise, board on a traditional rice barge boat as you embark on a journey that tantalises all of your senses. Apart from the great food and hospitality, relish in the city’s quiet facade - an ambience that reveals Bangkok’s muted ethos. Treading through one of the largest rivers in Thailand, the Chao Phraya River, your immersive experience begins from the get-go. As you board the Tahsaneeya Nava - an actual traditional rice barge boat whose interior is transformed into a dining space, your friendly hosts will greet you with a garlands of flowers and seat you down for a soothing evening. ************************************************************************************************ THE CULINARY JOURNEY (Scroll down for full menu) With three dinner options available, choose from Thai traditional, Thai seafood or Thai vegetarian - all of which are set to give you a true, wholesome taste of Thailand. Served in bite-sized portions, sample over 20 dishes that come together to form Thailand’s colourful food culture during this three-course meal. If you have no dietary restrictions, we’d strongly recommend you go with the Traditional Thai menu. With starters like Gai Hor Bai Toey, a chicken starter cooked in sous-vide till tender perfection. Served in a pandan basket, the dish comes with a tart Thai Plum sauce that will get your appetite going. Entrees consists of Salat Ped Num Makaam, a duck salad laced with sweet tamarind sauce, Pat Pak Roo-am Mitr, a homely veggies and oyster sauce ensemble and Thailand’s pride and glory: Gaeng Kee-aow Wahn Gai, the famous Thai Green Curry. A meal is hardly complete without something to satisfy the sweet tooth, dessert comes in the form of Khao Neeow Mamuang, also known as Mango Sticky Rice, Roti gap Gluay Kai, Lemon Curd Pancakes served with bananas and various sauces and many more. When it comes to food and Thai hospitality, the locals believe nothing succeeds like excess. If you have a dish that you fell in love with, simply let your waiter know and he’ll bring you a second serving from the kitchen. Should you be lucky enough, you’ll get away with a third portion! ************************************************************************************************ ABOUT THE BOAT Setting itself apart from other river cruises, the Loy Nava Bangkok Dinner Cruise is the oldest only river cruise in Southeast Asia that sails diners on an original rice barge. Made out of high-quality antique teakwood, the rice barge was a mean of transport and business for the locals back in its heyday. Loy Nava was purchased and fully refurbished so that the interior would evoke an antique and elegant vibe. Cruising the Bangkok waters for 75 years, this humble abode has served over 700,000 guests, many of which are celebrities, foreign dignitaries and even the royals! ************************************************************************************************ LIVE ENTERTAINMENT ON BOARD As you go along this gastronomical food trail, be glad to know there’s on-site entertainment as well. Following the unhurried pace of the boat, be mesmerised by the intricate outfits and precise articulation of the instruments as the performers coax you into a serene and calm state of mind, adding on to the relaxing ambience. ************************************************************************************************ TIMING & SESSIONS 6.00 PM 8.10 PM The Chao Phraya River Cruise has two sessions - one in the evening at 6.00pm and one at 8.10pm at night. Choose from either having the soft evening hues as your backdrop or amazing skylines that illuminates the the city after dark. Either way, the boat will sail past several prominent sights, including The Grand Palace, Rama VIII Bridge - Bangkok’s equivalent to the Golden Gate Bridge and The Temple of dawn, known as Wat Arun by the locals. As the two-hour cruise come to an end, you’ll be returned to the pier with food in your tummy and smiles on your face. ************************************************************************************************ FULL MENU (Halal options available on request) Traditional Thai Menu - (Recommended!)
