strIntroduction: PHUKET THAI COOKERY Phuket Thai Cookery School, the first and original Thai owned cooking school in Phuket, is located at the beautiful and serene Siray Beach away from downtown Phuket. As soon as you'll enter our academy you'll realize why we are so proud of our cookery. The school is not only perfectly setup for a relaxing and professional class, the location is truly postcard worthy and very unique for a cooking class! You'll also notice during the day how our staff takes the time throughout the class to share their knowledge with you and the rest of the attendees. We love to make the experience as fun and enjoyable as possible so look for our staff to use humor and their creativeness to make the whole experience enjoyable to all! ************************************************************************************************ SHOPPING AT THE LOCAL MARKET Once everyone has arrived at the cooking school our staff will take everyone to the local fresh market. Upon arrival at the fresh market we will shop for the freshest ingredients which we will need to prepare the day’s fantastic meal! Our staff will take the time to explain about the various spices, fruits, and vegetables that are found in the market and share some tidbits about many of these items. Once all of the day’s selections have been made we will make our way back to the wonderful location of the school to start preparing the first dishes of the day. ************************************************************************************************ TIME TO COOK Before cooking each dish, our teaching instructors demonstrate for everyone how to appropriately cook in order to get the best most authentic taste. Once each cooking demonstration is over then it is your turn to take your place at one of the cooking stations that has a view of the beautiful nearby beach and ocean and start cooking your authentic Phuket Thai meal! Our chef and assistants will be nearby to assistant with all the participants to not only answer all your questions in full detail, but also take pictures so you have unforgettable memories to bring home with you! ************************************************************************************************ THE MEAL Time to enjoy the “fruits of your labor”! Taste the delicious selection of foods you previously shopped the ingredients for and created yourself. At Phuket Thai Cookery, we encourage to enjoy a couple of dishes at a time instead of eating all five dishes at once. This lets the taste buds refresh themselves before you go ahead an savour another one of your delicious creations! Because of our awesome location when you aren’t cooking and eating you can take the time for a siesta on our wooden sundeck with plush pillows and cushions or even take a stroll in paradise along the Siray Beach. ************************************************************************************************ THE MENUS Monday – Thai Hot & Sour Prawn* Soup, Green Curry with Chicken* Saute Chicken* with Rice Papaya Salad Mango with Sticky Rice Tuesday – Chicken* in Coconut Milk Soup Panaeng Curry with Pork* Thai Fried Noodles with Prawns Spicy Minced Chicken* Salad Steamed Banana Cakes Wednesday – Closed Thursday – Thai Hot & Sour Prawn* Soup Yellow Curry with Chicken* Chicken* in Pandanus Leaves Spicy Meat* Salad Steamed Banana Cakes Friday – Chicken* in Coconut Milk Soup Green Curry with Chicken* Thai Fried Noodles with Prawns* Papaya Salad Mango with Sticky Rice Saturday – Thai Hot & Sour Prawn* Soup Massamun Curry with Chicken* Chicken* with Cashew Nuts Fried Rice with Crab Meat Steamed Banana Cakes Sunday – Thai Hot & Sour Prawn Soup Green Curry with Chicken* Spring Rolls Thai Fried Noodles with Prawns* Mango with Sticky Rice *Vegetable or other substitute available ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: #1 Phuket Cooking Class at Phuket Thai Cookery School

strIntroduction: KATA THAI COOKING CLASS When visiting Phuket come to Kata Thai Cooking Class located at Kata Beach to get an authentic home style cooking experience that will sure be a delight to your taste buds. Our head chef, Sally, makes the experience out of this world from beginning to end during our hands on cooking class. If your tour includes shopping at the local fresh market, learn from our experienced staff key information about picking out the right spices, fruits, and vegetables to get the most out of your cooking experience. You will be invited to test taste a variety of “foods” while at the market. Sally goes out of her way to make the atmosphere in the class as enjoyable as possible whether you are a seasoned cook or a self-declared mess in the kitchen either way you will finish the tour feeling like a Thai Master Chef. From years of classes Sally and our staff have been perfecting the course so it is great fun, entertaining, educational, and runs smoothly in a homey surrounding that invites friendships to be made and experiences recalled for a life time. ************************************************************************************************ SHOPPING AT THE LOCAL MARKET At the nearby local market you are introduced by our staff on how to find the perfect ingredients to help make the day’s meal taste perfect. Also, get tips to understanding the importance of including various ingredients necessary to make your meal the finest that you have ever cooked. Finally experience briefly the atmosphere of the local market that too many tourists miss out on. We will also encourage you to taste test some foods you may have never tried before! (Fried crickets, anyone?) *Local market is closed on days with heavy rain. ************************************************************************************************ TIME TO COOK Back at the Kata Thai Cooking Class each participant will find that they have their very own individual cooking station. Sally will then provide detailed cooking instructions - while she demonstrates cooking each of the three authentic Thai dishes on the day’s menu. You are sure to learn a lot as well as have a tremendous amount of fun as Sally, in her unique funny way, goes about sharing her love of cooking and shows how she makes cooking such a joy! While cooking your own meal Sally and the rest of our staff will be sure to be helpful if you experience any challenges or have questions about what to do next. Once all of the ingredients have been added and the dishes our fully cooked it is now time to enjoy the “fruits of your labor”. ************************************************************************************************ THE MEAL Whether you cooked the authentic and popular pad thai, green curry or a dish of cashew nut chicken, it is time to have a sit, enjoy your individually cooked Thai cuisine and interact with the other students! We always encourage a light-hearted, friendly atmosphere at our classes! Each meal at the Kata Thai Cooking Class includes 3 large dishes that will leave everyone full and happy. We're all family her, so book now to enjoy the best of Thailand - food, people, and culture! ************************************************************************************************ THE MENUS MONDAY Lunch: Tom Yum Pad Thai Green Curry Dinner: Tom Yum Pad Thai Green Curry ************************************************************************************************ TUESDAY Lunch: Tom Kha Kai Pad See Iw Red Curry Dinner: Green Curry Cashew Nut Chicken Thai Fried Rice ************************************************************************************************ WEDNESDAY Lunch: Tom Yum Pad Thai Green Curry Dinner: Fish Cake Green Curry Pad Thai ************************************************************************************************ THURSDAY Lunch: Panang Curry Tom Kha Kai Pad Thai Dinner: Spring Roll Green Curry Pad Thai ************************************************************************************************ FRIDAY Lunch: Chicken Sate Green Curry Tom Yum Dinner: Dim Sum Massaman Curry Thai Basil Stir Fried ************************************************************************************************ SATURDAY Lunch: Tom Yum Pad Thai Green Curry Dinner: Papaya Salad Thai Basil Stir Fried Green Curry *No class on Sundays **Note : Vegetarian and Halal Options Available** Although there is no set Vegetarian or Halal Menu, please inform us of your requirements and our chefs will prepare the appropriate ingredients for you! ************************************************************************************************ CLASS TIMINGS + DURATION Lunch Class : 11 AM Dinner Class : 4 PM Duration : 2 hours ************************************************************************************************

strIntroduction: SCHEDULE (Approximate) Full Day Tour - 8 AM to 4.30 PM Half Day Tour - 8.30 to 1.00 PM ************************************************************************************************ THE CANAL TOUR - A TIMELESS JOURNEY A memorable Bangkok Canal Tour is one of the best ways to see the many highlights of this sprawling, entrancing city. Escape the traffic, and the heat, with a comfortable cruise along the Chao Phraya River in an authentic Bangkok Canal Boat. With a maximum group size of only 12, you’ll have great views at all times, and be able to spend plenty of time at each attraction. Shaded to keep off the sun’s heat, the canal boats are a familiar sight in Bangkok and a slice of authentic Thai lifestyle in themselves. A conveniently flexible approach to sightseeing means you can choose from either a full-day or half-day tour, and then select the places you would most like to visit, from must-see riverside landmarks to the iconic floating markets. You’ll be travelling by a variety of transportation, from ferry to tuk-tuk and express boat, and the tour also includes return transportation from your hotel. You’ll be accompanied throughout by an English-speaking guide able to answer any questions you may have, and ensure easy entry to the attractions. If you want to explore Bangkok in style and comfort, simply step aboard this fantastic canal tour. ************************************************************************************************ FULL DAY TOURS *Recommended Itineraries* - These are two recommended itineraries that are always very popular with most visitors to Bangkok: 1. Bangkok Classic Canal Tour Sights Covered : - Grand Palace - Wat Pho - Orchid and Pandan Nursery One of the most breathtaking sights in all of Bangkok is the spectacular Grand Palace, home to the Thai Royal Family from 1782. You’ll have all the time you need to explore this vast complex of pavilions, landscaped gardens and courtyards, and also to see Wat Phra Kaew, the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, which is considered among Bangkok’s most unmissable icons. Actually carved from green jade, the statue is venerated as the protector of Thailand, and only the King or the Crown Price may touch it. The cloak around the Emerald Buddha is changed for the summer, winter and rainy seasons, an important traditional ritual of good fortune. The tour moves on to Wat Pho, also known as the Temple of the Reclining Buddha. This colossal statue measures 46m long, and is one of the largest in Thailand. Plated with gold, the soles of the Buddha’s feet are inlaid with Mother of Pearl. Just to see the scale and beauty of the statue is enough to take your breath away. Wat Pho is also the birthplace of traditional Thai massage. If you plan to have a massage while in Bangkok, you’ll find no better place. As this is a small-group tour, you’ll have time to enjoy what will certainly be one of the relaxing massages you’ll ever receive. Thailand is known for its beautiful orchids, and the Bangkok Classic Canal Tour finishes with a visit to a beautiful nursery where you can see these fragrant and delicate flowers in bloom. Also growing here are pandans, tropical trees that are very popular among Thai people who use their leaves as roofs and matting in homes. Choose the Bangkok Classic Canal Tour to see sites of immense religious significance, and see some of the country’s most iconic images. ************************************************************************************************ 2. Market Lovers Canal Tour Sights Covered : - Pak Khlong Talad - Wat Arun - Weekend Local Floating Market Wandering through Bangkok’s markets often creates some of the most enduring memories many visitors will take home from Thailand. Pak Khlong Talad, the Bangkok Flower Market, is the largest in the city, easily reached by river pier. It’s actually less of a market, and more of an experience - as you immerse yourself in the brightly coloured blooms, watch the vendors engaged in friendly bartering with their regular customers, and stop to smell particularly fragrant bouquets, you can’t help but feel elated. The market is open 24 hours, and can at times feel like a chaotic kaleidoscope, but you’ll visit during a quieter period, helping you take it all in. Your guide will be able to point out interesting flowers as you move around, and also help you barter the best price if you see any you’d like to brighten up your hotel room. Next, the tour moves on to Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn. Instantly recognisable from the Chao Phraya River, the temple is a masterpiece of construction, quite simply one of the most stunning in all of Thailand. A central spire, or prang, is surrounded by four smaller ones, and each has been intricately decorated with fragments of coloured glass and Chinese porcelain. If you have the energy, you can climb the central spire for some breathtaking city views. Finally, the Market Lovers Canal Tour takes you to another iconic Bangkok sight, the Floating Market. Vendors in boats trade fresh produce, laughter and gossip in scenes that have taken place for centuries. Besides the boat vendors, there are more than 200 stalls on land as well. Whether you’re looking for some tasty Thai snacks, a souvenir t-shirt or a refreshing coconut juice, Bangkok’s floating markets sell pretty much anything you could possibly require. Wander through at your leisure, chat with the stallholders, and enjoy one of the great authentic Thai experiences. Choose the Market Lovers Canal Tour to soak in the atmosphere of Thai river life that has gone on for generations, and to see a temple of immense religious significance. ************************************************************************************************ CUSTOM ITINERARY If you would like to customise your itinerary, you're more than welcome to! You can pick and choose the visits on your canal tour: Must See Riverside Landmarks (Choose one or two) : • Grand Palace and Temple of Emerald Buddha (Wat Phra Kaew) • Temple of Reclining Buddha and Thai Traditional Massage School (Wat Pho) • Temple of Dawn (Wat Arun) • National Museum (Former Palace of Vice King of Rama lV) • Flower Market (Pak Klong Talad) • Siriraj Hospital Museum Interesting Sites by Canal (Choose one) : • Artist House (home of a puppet troupe) • Forest Temple • Orchid and Pandan Nursery • Mouth of the Canal Temple • Local Floating Market (only available on weekend tours) ************************************************************************************************ HALF DAY TOUR For those interested in a shorter version of this tour - you may opt for the half day tour. Attractions : You may choose 2 sights from the 'Must see riverside landmarks' section above ************************************************************************************************ TRANSPORTATION This is not a private van tour. We will use a mixture of local transport such as taxis, BTS, MRT, river ferries and express boats! ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Bangkok Canal Tour on Chao Phraya River - A Timeless Journey

strIntroduction: ************************************************************************************************ FULL DAY HIGHLIGHTS - The Grand Palace - Wat Phra Kaew - Temple of the Emerald Buddha - Wat Pho - The Reclining Buddha - Bangkok Flower Market - Thonburi Canal - Long Tail Boat Ride - Wat Arun - Wat Saket - The Golden Mount Pick up time - 8 AM (Approx) Drop off time - 4 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************ GRAND PALACE & WAT PHRA KAEW To understand Thailand, one must understand its Buddhist heritage and traditions. Led by an experienced local guide who will escort you around the city in a comfortable, air-conditioned coach, this informative and enjoyable Bangkok Temple Tour is a private exploration of the key Buddhist sites in the Thai capital, giving you more flexibility and time in each place, and better communication with your guide. Begin with a visit to the breathtaking Grand Palace by the side of the Chao Phraya River. Built by King Rama I in the 18th century, the vast palace complex encompasses great halls, pavilions, courtyards and beautifully-landscaped gardens. You will see the mysterious and sacred Emerald Buddha in Wat Phra Kaew, said to protect the Kingdom. ************************************************************************************************ WAT PHO & THE RECLINING BUDDHA Moving on to Wat Pho, the Temple of the Reclining Buddha. Here, in one of Bangkok’s largest temple complexes, you will encounter 394 golden statues of Buddha seated in the lotus position, the marble inscriptions on the walls depicting Buddhist teachings on everything from religion to medicine and literature, and of course the magnificent Reclining Buddha itself. This revered statue is one of the largest in Thailand, the soles of its feet intricately detailed with mother-of- pearl and Buddhist symbols. Drop a coin into one of the 108 bronze bowls nearby for good luck, and to help the monks preserve the wat. ************************************************************************************************ LONG TAIL BOAT CRUISE & WAT ARUN After enjoying a light Thai meal you’ll embark on a pleasant cruise along the Chao Phraya River, heading out into the peaceful khlongs (canals) of the Thonburi district. Travelling by long tail boat, an exciting experience in itself, you’ll watch as tranquil scenes of river life unfold before you. Still within sight of Bangkok’s gleaming office blocks and skyscrapers, it feels a world apart. Upon reaching Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn, with its distinctive spires and murals, you can’t fail to marvel at the mesmerising central prang, decorated by King Rama III with seashells, glass and patterned Chinese porcelain so that it shimmers in the sun’s rays. Wat Arun once held the Emerald Buddha, and it is simply a masterpiece of craftsmanship. Don’t miss the elegant statues of animals and Chinese statues at the base of the central spire. ************************************************************************************************ FLOWER MARKET + WAT SAKET & THE GOLDEN MOUNT The Bangkok Temple Tour moves on to the celebrated Bangkok Flower Market, where you’ll be astounded by the variety of colourful blooms on display from all over the world, and the fantastic nature of the arrangements. There is a good-natured cacophony of voices as vendors shout their wares and customers bid at auction or at individual stalls, while all around fragrant aromas and bright colours intermingle. This is one of the truly unmissable Bangkok experiences, and the perfect opportunity to pick up a bouquet of lilies or roses. Your day will come to an end in a fitting location - Wat Saket, next to the Pom Mahakan Fort. There are around 300 steps leading to the summit of the Golden Mount, which is situated in the temple grounds, and if you have the stamina then the ascent is immensely rewarding, with sensational 360-degree views over the city, the Grand Palace and Wat Ratchanadda. There are several viewing-points along the way, and you’ll pass the shrine holding the Buddha relic which has been covered with gold leaf by devout worshippers for over a century. Along with Wat Pho and Wat Arun, Wat Saket is one of Bangkok’s most-visited sacred sites, which together give a vital insight into the history, culture and religion of this endlessly fascinating country. ************************************************************************************************ OUR PRIVATE DAY TOUR & GUIDE GUARANTEE: While there are many guides in Bangkok for you to choose from, rest assured that your comfort is our no. 1 priority and we reassure all our guests of the following: 1. This tour is for 10 hours and is customizable. We are more than happy to adjust your itinerary to include or exclude anything you'd like. It is our usual policy to dive deeper into your itinerary when we pick you up from your hotel so everyone is happy with the plan for the day. With our wealth of experience heading to all the major sightseeing spots on the island, we will ensure that your journey is as smooth as possible. 2. There will be absolutely NO forced shopping on our tours. Other guides in Bangkok might offer you low prices upfront to secure your booking but then proceed to bring you on a merry-go-round of stores to earn commission from your purchases. We do not play such games with our guests. Should you do decide to go shopping of your own accord, there is no pressure to buy whatsoever. 3. You will be guided by an experienced licensed guide from our team who is fluent in English. We know that clear communication from our guides is key for guests to have a fruitful experience in Bangkok. As such, we go to great lengths to ensure that your guides have the requisite level of English (as well as experience) to guide you through your day comfortably. ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Private Bangkok Temple Tour - Wat Pho, Wat Saket, Wat Arun!

strIntroduction: ************************************************************************************************ FULL DAY HIGHLIGHTS - The Grand Palace - Wat Phra Kaew - Temple of the Emerald Buddha - Wat Pho - The Reclining Buddha - Thonburi Canal - Long Tail Boat Ride - Wat Arun Pick up time - 8 AM (Approx) Drop off time - 4 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************ GRAND PALACE & WAT PHRA KAEW Take this superb Bangkok Day Tour by comfortable air-conditioned vehicle, and immerse yourself in the many highlights of Bangkok’s vibrant history and culture. Beginning on the banks of the Chao Phraya River, you’ll be guided around the magnificent Grand Palace, built by King Rama I and one of the country’s most popular landmarks. The seat of power for the kings of Siam for generations, on display in the Outer Court of the Grand Palace is the legendary Emerald Buddha, seated in a yogic position - despite the name, the statue is actually carved from a single piece of green jade. ************************************************************************************************ WAT PHO & THE RECLINING BUDDHA An easy walk brings you to nearby Wat Pho, one of the largest temple complexes in the city and sometimes known as “Bangkok’s first university”. Pause to look at the intricate murals which line the walls and were once used to educate students on subjects ranging from astronomy to meditation and warfare. You will also see close-up the immense Reclining Buddha, resplendent in gold leaf. Wat Pho is considered to be the home of traditional Thai massage, and you’ll have the opportunity to try one for yourselves at the hands of an expert practitioner. ************************************************************************************************ LONG TAIL BOAT CRUISE & WAT ARUN Following a delicious lunch, it’s time to relax on a gentle cruise by authentic long tail boat along the lively Chao Phraya River, branching out into the more serene khlongs (canals). In the Thonburi district, the “City of Treasures Gracing the Ocean”, you’ll witness captivating scenes of everyday river life a world apart from the glittering high-rises and busy streets of central Bangkok. The tour makes a brief stop for a wander around Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn), among the city’s most recognisable sights. Its towering spire is exquisitely-detailed with fragments of Chinese porcelain and coloured glass that make it shine in the sunlight. ************************************************************************************************ OUR PRIVATE DAY TOUR & GUIDE GUARANTEE: While there are many guides in Bangkok for you to choose from, rest assured that your comfort is our no. 1 priority and we reassure all our guests of the following: 1. This tour is for 6 hours and is customizable. We are more than happy to adjust your itinerary to include or exclude anything you'd like. It is our usual policy to dive deeper into your itinerary when we pick you up from your hotel so everyone is happy with the plan for the day. As such, we go to great lengths to ensure that your guides have the requisite level of English (as well as experience) to guide you through your day comfortably. ************************************************************************************************
