strIntroduction: •••••••••••••••••THE ULTIMATE ISLAND HOPPING EXPERIENCE••••••••••••••••• Escape the crowds and discover your own slice of paradise in the beautiful Phi Phi islands… The Phi Phi islands, lying just off the coast of Phuket, are widely-considered the most attractive in the Andaman Sea. With their secluded bays of pristine white sand ringed by towering limestone cliffs, mysterious caves, and turquoise waters rich in colourful marine life that prove irresistible for swimmers, it’s no surprise this is such a popular day-trip. The only problem is, many visitors arrive to find the bays already filled with boats, and it can be difficult to really appreciate the setting with so many other people around. If you prefer to see the sights unhurried, and get photo opportunities without lots of other people in the shot, then take this fantastic tour by speedboat Phuket to Phi Phi. As one of Phuket’s top speedboat day-trip operators, with years of tourism experience behind us and a reputation for passenger satisfaction, we’ve developed unique itineraries that beat the rush all day. Each and every trip is focused on your comfort, safety and enjoyment, which means NO overcrowded boats, professional, fully-licensed and multilingual crews, and always high-quality safety equipment. Early starts combined with our original itineraries keep you well away from the crowds in every destination. ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE Sights Covered - Phi Phi Islands & Maya Bay - Pileh Cove (Emerald Lagoon) - Loh Dalum Bay – 3 activities available: Visiting the famous Phi Phi Don view point, relax at the beach or take a walk through the Phi Phi Village - Viking Cave - Monkey Beach; - Loh Samah or Nui Bay (Snorkeling Spots) - Bamboo Island (Lunch on an amazing white sand beach!) This magical tour, sure to be one of the highlights of your stay in Thailand, departs at 7.30am from our luxurious lounge at the Royal Phuket Marina. You’ll be picked up from your accommodation in Phuket and transfer to our comfortable speedboat, long before other boats are ready to depart. First stop is incredible Maya Bay, which became world-famous with the release of The Beach. Now you can picture yourself as Leonardo DiCaprio, sunbathing on silky white sands fringed by dramatic limestone peaks, roaming jungle paths among chattering birds, or snorkelling over the coral in the picturesque bay. Pileh Cove, otherwise known as the Emerald Lagoon, is perhaps the most memorable stop on our tour, taking your breath away as soon as you see it. Leap from the boat into the warm waters for a swim, or simply bask in the incredible scenery. Passing Viking Cave, home to a colony of swiftlets whose nests are extremely valuable in Asian culture for their health-giving properties, the boat swings in close so you get the best views. Monkey Beach offers another highlight of the tour, where you’ll meet some cheeky and charming new friends while wandering the gorgeous white sands. You may even have the chance for a monkey-selfie. Next, you’ll head for either Loh Samah or Nui Bay, two scenic coves with tropical reefs ideal for a spot of snorkeling. We provide all the equipment you need, so just dive in! On Bamboo Island, while you immerse yourself in the jaw-dropping landscape, our crew prepares a fresh Thai lunch for you on the beach. If you’ve developed a big appetite, don’t worry, we pride ourselves on the quality of our delicious, unique meals. Enjoy, then relax on the smooth sandy beach. The final stop on our tour is majestic Mosquito Island, which is perfect for some afternoon snorkeling among shoals of brightly-coloured fish that inspire awe. Our fast speedboat will return you safely and happily back to the Royal Phuket Marina, from where a minibus will return you to your accommodation. Enjoy the memories - you’ll remember this Phuket day-trip for years. ************************************************************************************************ SIAM ADVENTURE WORLD The Phi Phi islands are one of the must-see destinations in Thailand, and this Siam Adventure's thrilling day-trip lets you soak up the scenery in peace. An early start, a fast speedboat, and a varied itinerary ensures you’ll always stay one step ahead of the crowds. Complimentary snacks and drinks are provided throughout the day, and a delicious beach lunch will be freshly-prepared. We are one of the top speedboat tour operators in Phuket, putting your safety and comfort first - no overcrowded boats, high-quality safety equipment and professional crews. ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP & DROP OFF By air-conditioned van from any hotel in Phuket. 6.10 AM (Approx) 5.00 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Phi Phi Island Tour by Speed Boat: Visit Maya Bay

strIntroduction: THE CLASS It’s often said that the best way to truly learn about a culture, and a people, is through their cuisine. With this authentic and fun Bangkok cooking class, you’ll not only be learning traditional cookery techniques and ingredients, but you’ll also be invited to share a delicious meal you’ve prepared yourself, alongside your classmates and the chef. So if you want to discover the tantalising secrets and fine arts of Thai cuisine, join this gastronomic adventure at Bangkok’s renowned Baipai Thai Cooking School. After selecting your ingredients, it’s time to work on the menu. Your chef will be guiding you not through just one appetizing dish, but four. While menus naturally vary with the season, you might be preparing spicy red curry with bamboo or fresh papaya salad with shrimp. Next, you’ll get acquainted with good techniques, the innovative fusion of flavours and aromas of Thai food, and how to prepare a beautifully-presented dish. Whether you’re a dab hand in the kitchen already or a complete novice, you’ll come away with new knowledge and skills, new friends, and a very happy stomach. Remember that no experience of Thai cuisine or cooking techniques is required - this fun and educational class will teach you everything you need to know. You don’t even need to cook at home. All that’s required is a love of great food and the curiosity to try new things. ************************************************************************************************ THE MEAL All this peeling, slicing and frying can really work up an appetite, so once you’ve finished cooking, it’s time to settle down and enjoy your creations. This shared feast is the perfect way to get to know your fellow chefs, so if you have any questions about Thai cuisine, or culture, then this is the ideal time to ask them. After your meal, when it’s time to say your goodbyes, every guest will be presented with their own recipe book, so you can put what you’ve learned into practise back at home, and amaze your friends and family with your newfound Thai cookery skills! ************************************************************************************************ BAIPAI COOKING SCHOOL This cookery class is accredited by the Thai Ministry of Education, and is hands-on from start to finish, so you’ll be putting what you learn into practise straightaway - unquestionably the best way to learn. Guidance is given from an experienced local chef, so you can be sure your instruction in Thai cuisine is authentic, and you’re being taught by a professional. While many Thai cookery classes take place in restaurants and hotels, which can sometimes feel a little impersonal, the reason the Baipai Cooking School, only 30 minutes from downtown, is so popular is that you’ll be welcomed into a delightful private house. Decorated with elegant and comfortable wooden furnishings, the effect is to create a tranquil environment where you’ll feel instantly at home. Every guest has their own individual cooking station in the spacious open-air kitchen. All the equipment you need is provided, and your friendly chef will be at hand throughout with clear and helpful guidance in English. ************************************************************************************************ THAI CUISINE While on the surface Thai cuisine may look harmonious and simple, underneath it can be very complex. Delicately balancing tastes and aromas, injecting just the right amount of spice, the best Thai chefs can produce attractive, delicious meals which require only light cooking. Your Baipai cookery class will show you the fundamentals, the vital grounding in Thai food from which everything else stems. ************************************************************************************************ THE MENUS You will learn how to cook one of these menus: Menu D1: Coconut Sticky Rice with Mango Chicken in Pandanus Leaf Papaya Salad Red Curry Pork with Bamboo Shoots Menu 4A: Chicken Satay Savory Prawn'n Herb Salad Stir-Fried Beef'n Chili Panang Curry with Chicken Menu D3: Water Chestnut in Coconut Milk Stir-Fried Chicken'n Cashew nuts Spicy Grilled Beef Salad Thai Style Fried Rice Noodle Menu 6A: Spring Rolls Minced Pork Salad North Eastern Style Chicken'n Galangal in Coconut Milk Soup Stir-Fried Rice Noodle Pork and Dark Soy Sauce Menu M1: Morning Market Tour Chicken in Pandanus Leaf Papaya Salad Red Curry Pork with Bamboo Shoots Menu D2: Thai Egg Custard Golden Bag Filled with Tasty Combination Hot 'n Sour Prawn Soup Green Curry Chicken Menu 5: Crispy Golden Cup with Tasty Fillings Glass Noodle Salad Masaman Curry with Chicken Stir-Fried Pork with Basil Leaves Menu M3: Morning Market Tour Stir-Fried Chicken'n Cashew Nuts Spicy Grilled Beef Salad Thai Style Fried Rice Noodle **Note : Vegetarian and Halal Options Available** Although there is no set Vegetarian or Halal Menu, please inform us of your requirements and our chefs will prepare the appropriate ingredients for you! ************************************************************************************************ CLASS TIMINGS From Monday to Saturday 9:30 am to 1:30 pm 1:30 pm to 5:30 pm ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Authentic Bangkok Cooking Class - Baipai Thai Cooking School

strIntroduction: FLIGHT OF THE GIBBON Deep in the rainforest northeast of Chiang Mai, a unique and exciting outdoor adventure awaits, one that allows you to be truly one with nature. With 33 different platform stations, 3 hanging sky bridges and 2 rappel descents, Flight of the Gibbon is an adrenaline-packed journey into the Thai jungle and is the largest of it's kind in Asia. ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE After being pick-up from your hotel in Chiang Mai, your adventure in the jungle will take about half a day. Before going into the forest, two professional guides called ‘sky rangers’ give detailed safety information. They check equipment and take the front and rear positions with every group of zip liners. They do more than just keep you safe; they give interesting facts about the animals and plants native to this region. Attached to a harness connected to an overhead cable system, (70 M above ground level) you’re not just speeding through the jungle; you’re interacting with it and the animals that live here. Don’t let your fear of heights stop you from witnessing the magic of the rainforest. Following the zip line adventure, join your fellow travellers at a restaurant where a delicious lunch awaits. Thai cuisine is incredibly fresh and mouth-watering! The final part of the tour is an optional hike up Mae Kampong waterfall. It’s a moderately difficult climb – the steps are quite large. Sit this one out if you like and admire the tranquil scenery on the ground. After an unforgettable day, you will be taken back to where you were picked up in Chiang Mai. ************************************************************************************************ GIBBONS & THE RAINFOREST As you fly through the treetops from one platform to another, you’ll enjoy a respite from the heat of Chiang Mai and discover plants not visible from the jungle floor. Keep your eyes open for the ape-like gibbons swinging from the trees. Early in the morning their songs can be heard from a great distance, and they last for up to thirty minutes! Take a moment to stop and listen to their distinctive vocalizations. ************************************************************************************************ A TRUE ECO-ADVENTURE - CONSERVE & PROTECT Flight of the Gibbon isn’t just about giving tourists a few hours of pleasure in the jungle: this is eco-tourism with an effort to conserve the forest and protect the gibbons, which are critically endangered. We are proud to say that we have been able to re-introduce gibbons into the rainforest. Our course is designed so that your day with us will not only let you have an experience of a lifetime, but leave virtually zero carbon footprint. ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP TIMING & SESSIONS (From Chiang Mai - To be confirmed upon booking) Sunrise : 5.45 - 7.15 AM Midday : 7.30 - 10.30 AM Sunset : 12.15 - 1.30 PM ************************************************************************************************ GROUP SIZE Max Participants in 1 Group - Not exceeding 9 guests for both safety and guest comfort. At least two Sky Rangers will accompany each group. ************************************************************************************************ HEIGHT, WEIGHT & AGE RESTRICTIONS Minimum Height - 100CM Maximum Weight - 130 KG Minimum Age - 5 yrs old ************************************************************************************************ WEATHER Rain or sun, we still go! In fact, the rain can actually add to the magic. There is rain-gear for sale for a minimal charge. ************************************************************************************************ PHOTOGRAPHY We have cameras! There is no need to bring a camera because we have installed a Flight of the Gibbon Adventure Picture system on our zip line course. You can also rent a GoPro HD on site to capture the experience! ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: 5% OFF Flight of the Gibbon Chiang Mai: Asia's #1 Zip Lining

strIntroduction: THE FULL DAY TRIP Pristine emerald waters, majestic islands and elusive water caves, Phang Nga Bay is a haven for the avid nature lover. On this James Bond Island day tour, you will explore every nook and cranny of the bay, and you'll get closer to the elements like never before! Your day exploring the tropics and beauty of Phang Nga Bay begins at 7:15am, where you’ll be picked up right from your hotel. About an hour and a half later, you’ll find yourself at the Kong Khien Pier, where’ll you bid farewell to the hustle and bustle of Phuket and into a peaceful respite that is Phang Nga bay. At the bay, you’ll be acquainted with your personal canoe that accommodates two to three passengers. And don’t worry, every canoe will be accompanied by a seasoned canoeist, who will also be your personal guide. Once you got your safety gears strapped on, you’ll be whisked away to your first destination: Panak Island. First, you’ll be paddled around the main body of the island, soaking in the sun as well as to marvel the grandeur of the islands. The sight from the waters looking up is one to behold and you'll find out first-hand why so many flock to Phang Nga bay. It is here as well your guides will let you in on the history of these islands and the many interesting facts known best by the locals. After admiring the grand views of the island from outside, you’ll progress to the fun part: exploring the sea tunnels and lagoons. Don’t be fooled by the unassuming holes in the islands, they are actually openings to the inner tunnels. Some are so small they require you to lay flat on your canoe just to enter. But once inside, look forward to the sight of the natural stalactites. Formed from minerals and water dripping through the cave ceilings, these icicle-shaped formations takes at least a century to grow just a centimeter! Once that is over, your canoe will bring you to your next mode of transport - the longtail boat. From there, you’ll get to enjoy the breeze as the boat cruises along the water and brings you to the Kao Phing Kan, or better known as the iconic James Bond Island. As if time stood still, the island retains the same facade, like how it was back in 1974 when James Bond movie, The Man with the Golden Gun, was shot. Don’t forget to capture a few selfies while you’re at it. Before the day ends, you’ll be back on board in time for lunch to get yourself energised for some sandy action by the beach. At Koh Hong island, you’ll be given ample time to soak in the rays and take a dip in the pristine cool waters, where your much-needed relaxation time will ensue. At 4pm, you'll arrive back on board scheduled for the pier, where you’ll be conveniently transported back to your hotel. The Ao Phang Nga National Park waits for your exploration. What are you waiting for? Click the ‘Book it’ button to get your James Bond Island Tour now! ************************************************************************************************ ITINERARY 7.15am to 8.30am: Hotel pick-up and drive to Kong Khien pier. 9.30am: Departure to Phang Nga Bay Visit & explore caves at Panak Island Visit Hong Island Visit James Bond Island Lunch on board Swim and Relax on the beach. 4pm: Getting back to the pier and transport to hotel ************************************************************************************************ AGE RANGE To apply for the 'Child' rate the guest must be in between 5 - 12 years of age. ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: James Bond Island Tour: Cruise and Canoe Phang Nga Bay

strIntroduction: WHITE WATER RAFTING Head off the beaten path and discover nature’s wonders at Ton Pariwat Wildlife Sanctuary, home to the rare Rafflesia kerrii, the world’s largest flower. Embark on an adrenaline-filled trip while experiencing Phuket’s natural wonders. The white water rafting tour is an exhilarating 5km trip that takes you down the rapids of Tom Pariwat Wildlife Sanctuary. Hop on a raft with 3 or 4 travel buddies and brace yourself for a wild, wet ride to the bottom! In the rainy season, the tide is even stronger and the path becomes a 9km long adrenaline rush. Fret not, however, if you’ve never braved the rapids before, as this beginner friendly tour includes a crash course led by experienced paddle guides. Following the white water rafting course, participants get to choose from a line-up of activities guaranteed to satisfy the ultimate adventure junkie. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ZIPLINE Take your adventure to new heights on the zip-line. With nothing more than a safety harness and helmet in the way, stretch your arms and pretend you are one with nature, cruising along the lush rainforest. Enjoy the breathtaking view from 6 platforms - 5 zip-line and 1 sky bridge. ATV Or put your driving skills to the test on the ATV and rough it out on not 1, but 2 courses. Whether you’re zipping through the local plantation or tropical rainforest, this thrilling ride is not to be missed. WILDLIFE SANCTUARY Otherwise, unwind with a trip to the low-rise waterfall in the heart of Tom Pariwat Wildlife Sanctuary, which offers the ideal respite from the city. Take a swim in its natural pool and emerge refreshed for the next leg of your trip. LUNCH A hearty Thai lunch refuels participants between activities. Participants will also make a pit stop at the Wat Suwan Kuha Cave Temple, known for its wild monkey population and iconic reclining Buddha. Round up the day with a relaxing herbal sauna before heading back to your hotel with fond memories of an adventure of a lifetime. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- COMBINATIONS AVAILABLE Rafting (1.5 hour) + Zip-line (0.5 hour) + Waterfall (1 hour) Rafting (1.5 hour) + Zip-line (0.5 hour) + ATV (1 hour) Rafting (1.5 hour) + Waterfall (1 hour) Rafting (1.5 hour) + ATV (1 hour) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ITINERARY - Departure from hotel via air-conditioned mini-van or coach to Best Rafting 4U Camp - Visit Suwan Khuha Temple monkey cave - Arrival at camp in Ton Pariwat Wildlife Sanctuary; deposit belongings in locker - Proceed with first 2 activities - Lunch at camp restaurant - Finish remaining activity - Herbal sauna and leisure time - Depart from camp and return to hotel --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- AGE RANGE Child - 5-12 years old ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
strTitle: 15% OFF 1-Day White Water Rafting Phuket Adventure

strIntroduction: The best way to get acquainted with Thailand is no doubt escaping the city; for adrenaline junkies and nature lovers, this ATV tour has everything to make you feel like Indiana Jones’ sidekick. The best part? The ATV tours happen in both Phuket and Phang Nga. ************************************************************************************************ PHUKET PACKAGES 1-Hour ATV Tour in Phuket The 1 hour ATV tour takes you through a mangrove forest, where you'll be trudging through dirt and muddy areas with moderate bumps. On the track, your friendly guides will introduce you to the local agriculture such as insect-eating plants, rubber plantations, and palm gardens. But don't worry if you're not into flora and fauna! At the end of the forest lies a hidden beach you can momentarily call your own. Taking a dip in the pristine waters is a rewarding way to relax before making your way back. 2-Hour ATV Tour in Phuket In addition to the mangrove forest that you'll visit in the itinerary for the 1 hour package above, the 2 hour package makes its way through more challenging terrains; don't expect to come out of this swamp squeaky clean! After a short break with cold drinks and seasonal fruits, animal lovers can look forward to spotting tropical animals, monkeys, and monitor lizards during the second hour of this tour. 1-Hour ATV tour + Flying fox and Rope Bridge in Phuket This package is for the adventure lovers. After the 1 hour ATV tour through the mangrove forest and on the beach, your sense of balance will be put to the ultimate test as you attempt to cross a rope bridge. The 100m Adventure bridge holds 6 different challenging stages, all of it requiring your body to be in perfect coordination. At the end, you’ll zipline down an 110m flying fox, through the mangrove overlooking a lake. ATV Tour + Team Building in Phuket Team building activities are available on site, and activities can be arranged prior. However, note that there have to be at least 10 participants. Activities include ATV riding, flying fox, catapult game, and gypsy bowling. ************************************************************************************************ PHANG NGA PACKAGES 3-hour ATV ride in Phang Nga Adventure begins from the get-go when you’re on the Phang Nga track. Crossing rivers and off-road trails, you’ll arrive at a hidden waterfall - a secret enclave known only by the locals. Take a dip here to rejuvenate your body as it prepares you for the remaining journey. Next comes the best part of the trip - the ride up a mountain peak. At the top, you’ll be offered an unobstructed view of the entire city, along with soothing mountain breeze to calm you from the high. During descent, you’ll get in touch with local communities when you stop for a break at the ATV village camp. From local farms to plantations, you’ll familiarize yourself with the countryside charm that is simply unparalleled by anything you’ve experienced. 3-hour ATV ride + 5km white water rafting in Phang Nga Before the 3-hour ATV ride, there’s no better way to build the spirit of camaraderie than joining forces in a 5km white water rafting course. Whether it’s with your squad or new friends made during the trip, teamwork is vital to get through without capsizing. Although the waves aren’t super strong, the unpredictability and frequency is enough to keep you excited. ************************************************************************************************ RIDER & PASSENGER OPTIONS If you are not comfortable riding yourself - no worries! You are welcome to choose the *passenger option* on the booking page. TRANSPORT Note: All tours end with transporting you back to the camp where drinks and fresh seasonal fruits will be served. After which, you’ll be brought back to your hotel/accommodation. AGE LIMITATIONS Phuket ATV Riders - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 8-15 yrs ATV Passengers - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 4-15 yrs ATV + Flying Fox - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 8-15 yrs Phang Nga ATV Riders - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 12-15 yrs ATV Passengers - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 4-15 yrs ATV + Rafting Riders - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 8-15 yrs ATV + Rafing Passengers - Adult 16 - 60 yrs / Child 4-15 yrs TIMING All Phuket Tours : 9am / 12pm / 3pm Phang Nga ATV Ride : 10am – 1pm Phang Nga ATV + White Water Rafting - 10am – 5pm
strTitle: ATV Phuket Tour: Explore Phuket’s Wild and Untouched Nature

strIntroduction: Starting in the heart of Chinatown, our ride explores its frenetic market environment. Winding through narrow alleyways, our senses come alive with the sights, sounds, and smells of a community in motion. We'll pass by shop houses selling everything from Buddhist amulets to recycled truck engines. Locals worshiping at hidden temples, ritual incense burnings, and the omnipresent spirit house display evidence of a culture centuries in the making. Crossing the Chao Phraya River with majestic views of the city skyline behind us, we visit Thonburi, the historic third capital of Thailand. Contrasting chaotic Chinatown, peaceful elements of local Thai life abound as we cycle through diverse residential communities. Inquisitive smiles and friendly greetings reinforce the feeling that we have truly left the "beaten path" and are now experiencing the REAL Bangkok. Departures: Twice daily Tour times: 08:00 - 11:00 or 14:00 - 17:00
strTitle: Cycle Historic Bangkok (3-hour bicycle tour)

strIntroduction: The tropical warm waters of the coast of Phuket are famous for scuba diving. They are perfect for training and novices or experienced divers wanting to Fun Dive as certified divers. Fun diving can be done on Day Trip boats as an all day experience of 2 or 3 dives. You will need to contact me regarding different dive trips available in different areas. Simons - Phuket Scuba Diving Tours has specialized in personal service and care from 2005. Simon has over 500 PADI teaching certifications. Simon lives all year round in Phuket offering personal advice on the basis of what you need. He also offers PADI courses and day trip personal dive buddies. One to one or small groups welcome.
strTitle: Dive the tropical waters of Phuket

strIntroduction: Once upon a time... actually just over 50 years ago, the first governor of Bangkok Dr. Chamnan Yuvaboon was looking for a holiday home outside of Bangkok and discovered a bullet wood tree by the river banks that was about to topple over. To save this tree he bought the land and built their family's holiday home. The sacred bullet-wood tree still stands here today within the 70-acre property that is now known as Sampran Riverside. Initially, the business started cultivating roses to supply to the Bangkok flower markets which had come from a passion the governor's wife had developed during her visit to England. Since then, under the care of three generations, Sampran Riverside has grown gradually to a 70-acre riverside property that is more like a community rather than a ‘typical’ resort. Today Sampran Riverside is still a family-run property close to Bangkok, where visitors can experience authentic Thai way of life and learn about our local wisdom. Itinerary for your day: 10.00-12.00: "Living The Thai Culture" Art and Craft Workshops Experience traditional Thai culture and the livelihood of the locals through our art and craft workshops dotted around the village that are taught by the villagers. Feed our wonderful elephants, meet our water buffaloes and take home self-made crafts. The list of crafts you can try your hand at! 1. Silk processing 2. Umbrella painting 3. Thai music and dance 4. Traditional weaving 5. Clay pottery 6. Thai kitchen 7. Fruit & vegetable carving 8. Garland making 9. Rice farming 10. Bamboo dancing 11. Herbal pavilion 12. Thai martial arts 13. Traditional photo booth 12.00-13.30: "Vanda Restaurant" Proceed to Vanda Restaurant to enjoy a sumptuous buffet lunch offering a range of international cuisines including Thai, Western, Japanese and Vegetarian. 13.30-14.15: "Leisure Walk" Free time to take a leisurely walk through our chemical-free botanical gardens and explore a variety of native species of herbs and flowers including organic roses. All our gardens are certified organic to IFOAM and EU standard. You will have some time for shopping for handmade handicrafts and local souvenirs or elephant riding until the starting time for the Thai Cultural Show. 14.15-14.30: "Elephant Demonstration" After the Thai cultural show, watch a short elephant demonstration to learn actual facts about these wonderful giant creatures in Thailand 14.45-15.30: "Thai Village Cultural Show" Relax and take a seat in an air-conditioned auditorium to enjoy the longest running daily show in Thailand. Live traditional Thai music accompanies the performance that highlights the Thai way of life, reflected through everyday activities, festivals and traditional celebrations. Highlights include: Buddhist ordination ceremony, Muay Thai (Thai boxing), typical Thai wedding ceremony, sword fighting and fast paced bamboo dancing.
strTitle: Living the Thai Culture: Workshops, Show, Elephants, Lunch

strIntroduction: Sampran Riverside is a half a century old family-run property about an hour drive from Bangkok. All gardens and the 10-acre farm at the property are certified organic which came after over 7 years of hard work when we first started to venture out in organic agriculture together with the local community. Upon arrival, we meet at the hotel lobby for a short briefing before we begin the adventure. Itinerary for your day with us: 10.00-10.30hrs Begin your culinary experience with a guided tour around a homely garden where Thai common herbs are grown organically. Learn about their health benefits and the concept behind Thai food. 10.30-12.00hrs Start your traditional Thai cooking class, which will take place outdoor under an antique Thai house amidst a certified organic herbal garden. Learn the techniques from a local experienced chef and prepare 4 popular Thai dishes: ‘Khanom Pang Na Moo’ Minced pork on toast, ‘Som Tam’ Raw Papaya Salad, ‘Kai Yang’ Grilled Chicken, and ‘Tom Yam Kung’ Lemongrass Soup with Prawns. 12.00-13.00hrs Proceed to Inn Chan Restaurant to enjoy your own cooked dishes. The chef will prepare 3 additional dishes for a full course Thai set lunch: Stir-fried Organic Morning Glory with Chili and Garlic, Massaman Curry with Beef and Stir-fried Chicken with Cashew Nuts. Steamed Jasmine Rice and Coffee/Tea are included in the meal. 13.00-14.15hrs Free time to take a leisurely walk through our chemical-free botanical gardens and explore a variety of native species of herbs and flowers including organic roses. All our gardens are certified organic to IFOAM and EU standards. Some time for shopping for handmade handicrafts and local souvenirs or elephant riding until the starting time for the Thai Cultural Show. 14.15-14.30hrs Elephant Demonstration After the Thai cultural show, watch a short elephant demonstration to learn actual facts about these wonderful giant creatures in Thailand. 14.45-15.30hrs Thai Village Cultural Show Relax and take a seat in an air-conditioned auditorium to enjoy the longest running daily show in Thailand. Live traditional Thai music accompanies the performance that highlights the Thai way of life, reflected through everyday activities, festivals and traditional celebrations. Highlights include: Buddhist ordination ceremony, Muay Thai (Thai boxing), typical Thai wedding ceremony, sword fighting and fast paced bamboo dancing.
strTitle: Learn about Thai Herbs & Cook your Own Traditional Thai Food

strIntroduction: Afraid of cycling in Bangkok? Shed your fears. We'll take you off the main roads and into the trails of the city behind the facades. Bangkok Nightriders is an unusual journey through Bangkok's old riverside domains. From cool, hidden hangouts and rooftop bars to ancient communities, the forgotten, mysterious and haunted realms of Bangkok's village-like neighbourhoods, we'll ride through bustling night markets and magnificent temples, a one of a kind night experience of Bangkok. When ever you hear the term "One Night in Bangkok" after this ride, it will evoke a complete new and different image of Bangkok in you. We’ll meet at 6pm at the Democracy Monument (McDonalds) and set off for an amazing loop through Bangkok’s ancient communities at night. We’ll start at the southern tip of Chinatown from where we’ll weave our way through hidden routes past some of Bangkok’s oldest and crumbling Chinese trading houses towards Rattanakosin, the royal compound with splendid temples. We'll introduce you to local, cool hangouts and hidden jewels that you can revisit again to impress your friends. We'll squeeze into alleys so narrow a bicycle can barely fit through and so dark and spooky no local walks through them for they believe these places are haunted. It will give you an idea of the intricate urban chaos and their urban legends that makes this part of Bangkok so unique. Besides haunted alleys and overgrown houses, you’ll find temples and shrines, hip local night markets, picturesque architecture and laneways, hidden hangouts, rooftop bars, cemeteries, bewitched old Banyan trees, off the beaten track markets, and pristine neighborhoods. We'll end up at Chinatown’s buzzing heart where we will have dinner and end by 11pm. This is a little adventure ride that avoids the main attractions but brings you close to pulse of Bangkok’s old city at night, it’s neighborhoods and hidden jewels. Cycling distance: roughly 15km Tour grade: easy Cycling conditions: flat riding, 70% traffic free, mostly through quiet local alleyways which can at times get extremely narrow, busy markets
strTitle: Explore Bangkok's ancient city & night markets

strIntroduction: Our popular half day bike tour in Phuket Island will invite our guests to ride in the north east of Phuket Island, an area known for its small traditional Thai villages. Guests joining this Bike tour with Amazing Bike Tours will also have the opportunity to visit Phuket's Gibbon Rehabilitation Center and see how gibbons are cared for before being released back in to the rain forest. This half day Phuket Bike tour will have our guests cycling on small country roads, and off the track through palm and rubber tree plantations along dirt paths. The route does also include a few hills. This bike tour is followed by our support vehicle, apart from the off road sections where the mini bus is never too far away. Please note we only provide free transfers from the following areas: Pick up times for bike tours: Rawai/Nai Harn: 7:10-7:20am Kata/Karon: 7:30-7:40am Patong: 7:50-8:10am Kamala: 8:10-8:20am Surin/Bang Tao: 8:20-8:30am Laguna: 8:30-8:40am Note: For the Turtles & Waterfalls bike tour we also include a free transfer from all the northern west coast beaches, Layan, Naithon, Nai Yang and Mai Khao. Note: For areas not listed above, additional charge for transportation will apply. Pickup time is 20 Minutes earlier for the following tours: Koh Yao Noi day trip
strTitle: See the Phuket countryside on a half-day bike tour

strIntroduction: Phuket is not exactly a small place. It has many nooks and crannies that even repeat visitors know nothing about and it takes a long time to ‘discover’ all that is on offer on the island – especially bargain and quality shopping. Join our tour and be whisked from bargain treasure trove to treasure trove picking up gifts, souvenirs, local textiles and art, scents, carvings, name-brand sportswear, quality silk bolts and clothing, pewter, comical T-shirts, bags, and much, much more. Heading off bright and early in the morning after being picked up in a minivan, you’ll be supplied with a name tag, an eco-friendly shopping bag, mosquito repellant and candies. The tour’s minivan will then take you to chronologically and logistically pre-chosen locations, spending about an hour in each place. Throughout the day you will visit 6-8 retail outlets and enjoy a sumptuous lunch in a scenic and breezy spot at midday. It’s a relaxed and informative day out with the added satisfaction of knowing that you’ve landed some killer bargains. Wherever possible we have prearranged discounts for tour members – simply show your name tag at the till and receive up to 30% off the ticketed price!
strTitle: Go on a Phuket Shopping Tour with an Insider

strIntroduction: Culinary > >> Experience what locals eat! The tour begins with tasty local brunch – fill your stomach before the walk. Hence, we strongly suggest only a small breakfast from your hotel before this tour. After the walk, a plethora of local Phuket dishes, prepared with aggressive flavors distinctive to the island, will be sampled at local food center. Trails >>> We will then take a leisurely walk around the Old Town of Phuket, viewing the architectural heritage of Phuket in Sino-Portuguese style. Attention is directed to the subtle symbolism hidden within the construction details of Chinese shop houses, one city block deep. It is a sensual discovery of the facets of Peranakan culture and how the island relates to her urban cousins that line the coast of the Thai/Malay peninsula.
strTitle: Phuket Heritage Walking Tour & Food Tour

strIntroduction: Silver Jewellery Program Our craft workshops are designed for beginners of all ages. Most of our students have little or no training in craft techniques yet they are able to produce craft pieces of exceptional quality at the end of the workshop. We will try our best to ensure you have an enjoyable time and leave the workshop with new skills to help you pursue your craft interests in the future. 1 Day Course For those students who do not have much time, we have developed a 1-day course in which you can make a simple and beautiful ring or pendant. After completing the basic program, you can pursue intermediate level projects. 2 Day Course You can make a simple and beautiful ring and pendant or slightly more complicated design of either a pendant or ring. 5 Day Course In our five days program we have developed three projects for beginners. Each project has a different level of difficulty. If you are able to complete the three projects before the end of the course you may pursue an individual project in consultation with the instructor. Project 1: Pendant For the pendant project you may choose from several predetermined designs. Through direct interaction with the materials and tools and with one to one instructions from the teacher you will learn the following techniques. - Piercing/drilling - Sawing out graphic shapes - Filing and refining forms - Forming a silver dome - Silver polishing The project takes about one day to complete. Project 2: Ring Learning to make a perfect circular form is one of the most basic and important skills in jewellery making. The circular form can be used for the design of many jewellery objects such as chains, bangles ear hoops and rings. In this project you will learn to form a perfect ring from silver sheet or wire. We will cover the following techniques: - How to determine the correct size of a ring for any individual - Torch techniques for soldering. You will solder your ring closed using gas torch - How to form sheet or wire into a perfect circular form - Surface decoration and texturing techniques. Metal finishing and polishing This project takes about 1 day to complete. Project 3: Stone Setting Stone setting can be one of the most demanding and rewarding aspects of jewellery making. Through completing one of these two projects you will learn: - How to select a stone for trouble free bezel setting - Design considerations for bezel stone setting - The techniques and tools for bezel setting - How to solder a bezel setting on to a ring or pendant This project takes about 2-3 days to complete.
strTitle: Create your own silver jewelry

strIntroduction: Each day, our students are picked up from Chiang Mai and driven to the culinary school. On a typical day our lessons begin with a trip to a local country market where you will be guided around and learn how to select and buy fresh Thai ingredients that will be needed for that day's Cooking Class lesson. For many, this tour of the morning market is an unforgettable experience in itself, leaving them with lasting memories of new sights, sounds and wonderful spicy aromas, as well as a broader knowledge of Thai fruits, vegetables and spices. This experience and new knowledge is especially useful to those who want to impress their friends back home with delicious Thai cuisine. Returning to the delightful semi-rural setting of the cookery school itself, Pom will take you through every stage of the Cooking Class process until, at the end of the session, you will have the opportunity to taste and eat your own creations. You will learn by doing, not merely watching, so each course is full of activity and fun. Every student receives a copy of our full-color, professionally printed Cookery book. This book contains information about common ingredients in Thai Cooking Class and all our recipes. It will help you reproduce the tasty dishes you have learned, and more, in the comfort of your own home kitchen. We are located away from the hubbub of the city, yet just 14 km from the centre of Chiang Mai (less than 9 miles). It is an ideal home-style learning environment in a charming open-air Thai style kitchen, surrounded by aromatic herb gardens and overlooking rice paddies. Our students can relax in a tranquil and cozy atmosphere, far from the maddening crowds. Our superlatively hygienic premises operate at the highest standards of cleanliness. Students work with top quality Cooking Class utensils, and a separate work station is provided for each student. We believe that our inspirational environment will enhance your Cooking Class experience. We cannot judge ourselves and tell you that we are the best, but we can assure you that what we offer is second to none and that you will not be disappointed if you decide to accept Pom's invitation to join us for a very special day of cooking class and savoring Thai dishes.
strTitle: Pick and cook the best food from Chiang Mai's markets

strIntroduction: Embark on a journey to meet Phuket's true local inhabitants with a professional photographer. This photo tour will take you to Phuket's Big Buddha where you have a glimpse of the life led by the monks.Then, you will visit the busiest and oldest fresh market where you will meet the local vendors and their patrons shopping for their daily fresh supplies. Finally, you will meet the most adorable kids at the Sea Gypsies Village. You will be accompanied by a professional photographer who will help you shoot the best holiday pictures ever. Or, if you don't want to take the pictures yourself, the photographer will take the pictures for you and you will receive a CD with all the day's pictures.
strTitle: Meet Phuket's inhabitants

strIntroduction: Beneath the postcard paradise attractions of beach umbrellas and Mai Tais, lies an important gem of Malacca Straights history developed over the course of centuries. Phuket’s blend of cultures is obviously evident in its people and architecture – a fusion that is unique in most of Southeast Asian countries. The educational tour service by ‘Phuket Heritage Trails’ is designed to take you to closer look into the unique and true charms of Phuket Island, as well as to explore some of the sites known only to the locals. You will be guided through a dazzling, urban landscape, where we take in living examples of Southern Thai customs influenced by the Chinese and Malay settlers. Meet the Locals Tour - getting to know the real ‘Phuket People’ and our ‘Cultural Heritage' in this seven-hour program with your choice of Morning or Afternoon tour. Experiences on this tour include: - Culinary Experience - Short Walking around Phuket Town - Visiting a Century-Old House Museum - Panoramic Hilltop View - Meeting the Sea Gypsies Fishing Villagers - Thai Buddhist Temple - Chinese Taoist Temple - Lunch or Dinner - Transportation to and from hotel in Phuket
strTitle: Discover Phuket's cultural heritage and meet its locals

strIntroduction: 4 CRUISE OPTIONS Please choose the cruise option that suits you, noting the different durations. CRUISE 1 Daytime cruise along the Mae Ping, pausing at a local farm to explore the herb garden and taste a fresh fruit juice. Duration - 2 hours ******************************************************************************************** CRUISE 2 As Cruise 1, but featuring a lunch of Kao Soi (Chiang Mai-style smooth and spicy noodle soup cooked to a family recipe) at the Farmer’s Landing. Duration - 2.5 hours ******************************************************************************************** CRUISE 3 As Cruise 1, but featuring a set Thai menu at the Farmer’s Landing. Duration - 2.5 hours ******************************************************************************************** DINNER CRUISE Cruise 4 : Dinner Cruise : Romantic evening cruise accompanied by a delicious Thai dinner. Evening guests can choose from a set menu or select their own Thai meal. Please alert us beforehand for any dietary requirements. Duration - 1 hour 15 min ******************************************************************************************** CRUISE SCHEDULE AND PICK UP INFO Day Cruises : Day cruises run every hour from 9 AM until 7 PM. Pick up time : 20 Min before cruise departure time. Dinner Cruise : Pick up time : 5.20 PM (Approx) Departure time : 6.30 PM ******************************************************************************************** MAE PING RIVER CRUISE The beautiful Mae Ping River is known as ‘the lifeline of the province’ due to its prominent role in agriculture, trade and fishing in the Chiang Mai region. On its way to joining up with the mighty Chao Phraya River, the Mae Ping flows through two Thai National Parks, providing vital irrigation to rice paddy plantations as it meanders gently along. Chiang Mai, Thailand’s second city, has been built up alongside the Mae Ping over 700 years, meaning that a cruise along the river is an indispensable tour while staying here, one that illuminates traditional lifestyles which are centuries old. This professional river boat company has been operating tours along the Mae Ping for 20 years now, and the boat pilots know every curve of the waterway. As the boat drifts leisurely away from the jetty, you’ll pass through the downtown area, under bridges, past spectacular temples and busy riverside cafes, and the Warorot market - Chiang Mai’s Chinatown. Bring along a camera - on display as you travel through the Chiang Mai’s northern suburbs, some of the city’s swankiest mansions and most elegant riverside homes, often made in the traditional style from teak wood. Trees full of birdsong drape over the river, fishermen cast their nets into the water, while locals bathe and wash clothes. The vital role of the river for those that live in this area is very clear. After school, it’s a favourite activity of children to splash around at the water’s edge, so anticipate doing a lot of waving! Though the Mae Ping is no longer as important to commerce as it once was, you’ll still see the occasional boat laden with wares moving slowly along, as other charming scenes of rural river life unfold on both banks. ******************************************************************************************** FARMER'S LANDING The daytime cruises pause at the home of a local farmer, where you’ll be shown around a resplendent herb garden, used for both medicinal and cookery purposes, and a jasmine rice paddy, to see how it is cultivated. Settle down either for lunch, if you choose that option, or a mouthwatering juice made of fresh fruit and lemongrass. Note that the Dinner Cruise Chiang Mai does not include a stop at the Farmer’s Landing. Dinner is served aboard the boat instead. ******************************************************************************************** WHY YOU SHOULD TAKE THIS TOUR Chiang Mai is Thailand’s second city, known for a more tranquil atmosphere than bustling Bangkok. The Mae Ping River has always played a central role in Chiang Mai’s history and culture, and though there are many guided tours available both in the city and out into the stunning countryside, a river cruise is one of the most popular options. You’ll encounter many memorable scenes of traditional Thai river life, before stopping for a very friendly welcome at the home of a local farmer and his family. Here’s you’ll learn about the importance of the river to agriculture in the region, and have a delicious lunch should you choose. Alternatively, see the sights of Chiang Mai by night, with an evening cruise serving a tasty Thai meal in a tranquil environment.
strTitle: 10% OFF Mae Ping River Cruise Chiang Mai

strIntroduction: PICK UP & DROP OFF TIMINGS (Approx) Morning Tour - Pick up : 8.00 AM Drop off : 12.00 PM Afternoon Tour - Pick up : 1.30 PM Drop off : 5.00 PM ******************************************************************************************** SIGHTS COVERED Doi Suthep Temple Meo Hill Tribe Village ******************************************************************************************** WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE Experience the spiritual beauty and the timeless traditions of northern Thailand mountain life on a fascinating Chiang Mai day tour. Just minutes away from the city you will find yourself in contrasting landscape of emerald green forested hills home to the scared mountaintop Wat Doi Suthep temple and colourful hill tribe culture. The Doi Suthep tour begins at the iconic Buddhist monastery and temple of the same name, an ancient sacred pilgrimage site that has inspired and guided devotees for more than 500 years. It exudes all the serenity and atmosphere you would expect from such a revered site, but also offers sweeping panoramas of the Chiang Mai city skyline. This Chiang Mai day tour also ventures deeper into the scenic landscapes of Doi Suthep Pui National Park en route to see the traditional culture and way of life of the Meo Hill tribe. Following your knowledgeable local guide, immerse yourself in the time-honoured practices and customs of the hill tribe village community and feel its unique connection with the natural surroundings. Featuring insightful local stories and an comfortable air-conditioned vehicle to get you there and back, this Doi Suthep and Meo Hilltribe village tour is the ideal introduction to the dramatic scenery of mountainous northern Thailand and the distinctive local lifestyles it sustains. With two half-day tours to Doi Suthep every day it offers added convenience and more options to escape the crowds. ******************************************************************************************** WAT DOI SUTHEP Wat Doi Suthep literally stands head and shoulders above all other temples in Chiang Mai at a lofty altitude of more than 3,500 feet perched high on Suthep Mountain. On arrival at the Wat, there is an additional 306 steep steps to negotiate before you enter the temple or take a short funicular ride to the entrance. It is among the most sacred sites in Northern Thailand and the Wat itself is among the very finest examples in the region.. In the temple’s upper terrace is the standout feature - a gleaming golden chedi which sparkles in the sunlight. Surrounding it are richly decorated murals, bells and shrines. A small museum is also on-site containing various ancient relics and photographs. Close by you will encounter the famous White Elephant shrine which commemorates one of Chiang Mai’s most colourful legends. According to a story retold over centuries, a holy relic, thought to be a bone from the Lord Buddha was placed on the back of a white elephant which climbed the mountain at Doi Suthep and immediately before collapsing and dying of fatigue, signalled the exact spot where the relic was to be enshrined. At this very spot Wat Doi Suthep was established as a monastery by King Kuena with construction beginning in 1386. Before departing the temple, stop awhile at the lower terrace to contemplate the captivating views of the city rooftops and the Ping Valley. ******************************************************************************************** MEO HILL TRIBE VILLAGE After leaving the temple the tour continues a few miles further into Doi Suthep National Park to visit the Meo hill tribe village, which nestles dramatically on a hillside amid lush tropical scenery. Its inhabitants are also known as the Doi Pui Hmong who follow a mostly traditional way of life, with agricultural practices supplemented by tourism. The village itself cascades down the hillside framed above and below by beautifully tended rock gardens, lychee orchards and pleasant trails through the trees. Mountain mist also blankets the hillside, adding to its atmospheric appearance. The Meo Hilltribe community is noted for its colourful and intricate traditional hemp costumes and you will also sense its artistic heritage too with examples of fine hand-made handicrafts to browse and buy. The village features a small museum showing interesting artefacts relating to the village’s clan lifestyle, its rituals, cuisine and unique traditions. From the artistic wares, stunning nature and photogenic kids in colourful attire, the Meo Hilltribe offers many captivating sights. It is also easy to interact with the community and learn first-hand about their unique rural lifestyle. ********************************************************************************************
strTitle: Chiang Mai Day Tours : Doi Suthep & Meo Hilltribe Village

strIntroduction: PHANG NGA BAY TRIP Sights covered Immense mangrove tree coasts Shrimp farms Magnificent limestone karsts Dramatic rock formations Secluded beaches James Bond Island Coastal jungles Floating Muslim Village - (Total traveling flight time is approximately 30 mins. originating and ending at Sakoo Heliport) -------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ready for a journey of a lifetime? Have your cameras ready because we’re going to take you on a voyage to nature’s hidden beauty. Only a few have the fortune to absorb this magnificent creation of nature. Now it’s your opportunity to appreciate what was once thought of as, “only for the privileged” in discovering Phang Nga’s majestic limestone cliffs flourished graciously amid the emerald bay of the Andaman Sea. Your odyssey will commence from Phuket heliport, crossing over from Phuket directly to Phang Nga, where you will start to see the lush vegetation, mangrove trees, small villages, and shrimp farms dispersed across the region. Once you begin to pass those regions, you’ll encounter these extraordinary limestone rock formations, as we cruise alongside them. You will also notice a floating village from afar, and as you approach, you’ll see Phang Nga’s famous Koh Panyi or “Muslim floating village.” We’ll then circle around this village, for you to capture this moment and see how man and nature coexist gracefully. Nature has its ability to astonish the advent explorer as we approach Khao Tapu, which means “Nail Mountain” or more like “Nail Island.” A more familiar name would be “James Bond Island,” made famous by the movie “Man with the Golden Gun.” The actual main island is Koh Ping Kan, which means “leaning on each other island.” This is named after the limestone, which is split in two and the one half is leaning against the other. Now you are headed over to the kayaking island of Phang Nga Bay, where you will cross over the secret lagoon, hidden within the limestone island itself. From the secret lagoon of Phang Nga, we head straight back to the Phuket heliport for your safe return and you can decide to enjoy our Phuket adventure. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
strTitle: Phuket Helicopter Tours - Pearl of the Andaman from Above!

strIntroduction: ITINERARY For guests from Khao Lak 6:30am Pick up at your hotel, transfer to the private pier in Khao Lak For guests from Phuket 6:30am Pick up at your hotel,transfer to the Yacht Haven close to Sarasin Bridge for less land transport time 7:30am Departure to Similan Islands by speedboat 9:00am arrival at Similan Islands-National Park 2-3 times snorkeling (together about 2 hours) Visits to several islands and beaches of the National Park Donald Duck Bay Picnic lunch on a beach (Thai Food) Leisure time on the beach Walk to Sailing Rock (View Point) 3:00pm Departure to Khao Lak 4:30pm Arrival at Khao Lak Pier, transfer to the hotel 4:30pm Arrival at the Phuket Yacht Haven, transfer to the hotel 5:30pm Arrival at your hotel ************************************************************************************************ THE SIMILAN ISLANDS - THAILAND'S 'JEWEL IN THE CROWN' Get there fast - and then take it slow. Zip across the azure Andaman Sea by speedboat for a tropical Thai island experience like no other on this Similan Island tour from Phuket. The islands of the Similans are deservedly lauded for their rich beauty above and below the water line, and have long been the Holy Grail for seasoned scuba divers in search of pristine, uncrowded coral reefs. Lying 64km off the mainland, the Similan National Park exudes that quintessential tropical desert island vibe, far removed from the bustling beaches of Phuket. On this day trip will escape the crowds and experience your very own piece of paradise. Fine white sugar coated sandy bays contrast with huge granite boulders protruding from the calm turquoise waters and the verdant green rainforests of the interior. A little exploration inland on one of the hiking trails may spot a number of small critters such as bats, lizards, flying lemurs and crab-eating monkeys. Reputed to be Thailand’s oldest coral reefs, there is an astounding 500 species of hard and soft corals, harbouring an eclectic range of marine life. The Similans offer some of the most memorable snorkelling opportunities in all of Thailand with reefs teeming with coral fish, turtles, manta rays and much more. As you come up for air, also look toward the sky to glimpse sea eagles flying overhead, kingfishers, or the endangered nicobar pigeon. Once a haven for sea gypsies, the islands are relatively isolated and mostly uninhabited. Due to the monsoon season the national Park is only open to the public from October to May each year so don’t miss a rare opportunity on this Similan Island tour from Phuket to explore a true tropical paradise. It is sure to be an unforgettable highlight of any trip to Thailand. This full day tour ensures you are always one step ahead of the crowds, visiting sublime, secluded beaches and enjoying ample time to snorkel in crystal clear waters. Kicking off with an early morning hotel pickup, you will be met by comfortable speedboat at Khao Lak private marina to take you direct to the Similan Island for a day of tropical island bliss. Once arriving on the islands in the morning, you will enjoy two full hours of uninterrupted snorkelling at different spots, enjoying close encounters with the captivating marine life. There is time to unwind with a delicious Thai picnic lunch on a secluded beach following a visit to the Similans’ most iconic landmark, Donald Duck Bay. After lunch set off and explore the beach scenery at your leisure or stroll up to the Sailing Rock viewpoint to gaze over a wonderful ocean panorama. As late afternoon approaches the fast speedboat will then whisk you safely back to Khao Lak for transfer back to your hotel in Phuket. ************************************************************************************************ SIAM ADVENTURE WORLD The Similan islands are one of the must-see destinations in Thailand, and this Siam Adventure's thrilling day-trip lets you soak up the scenery and white-sand beaches in peace. An early start, a fast speedboat, and a varied itinerary ensures you’ll always stay one step ahead of the crowds. Complimentary snacks and drinks are provided throughout the day, and a delicious beach lunch will be freshly-prepared. We are one of the top speedboat tour operators in Phuket, putting your safety and comfort first - no overcrowded boats, high-quality safety equipment and professional crews. ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP & DROP OFF By air-conditioned van from any hotel in Phuket. 6.30 AM (Approx) 5.30 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Phuket to Similan Island Tour - An Unforgettable Day Trip

strIntroduction: Phuket has a whole lot of things - pristine beaches with golden sand, amazing street food that you would want to live on and of course the smorgasbord of places shop at. For travellers, it’s often a conundrum to suss out the best of the best. The internet can only help you that much. Rather than racking your brains on the places to go, join us at the Phuket city day tour, where local tour guides will bring you to discover Phuket’s best - dip your toes in clear blue waters, view the city’s vast expanse from above and learn about Phuket’s rich architectural history while you’re at it. Whether you’re in Phuket for a one-day layover or trying to get in tuned with the vibes of this city before your weekender begins, experience all of Phuket’s charm at the Phuket city day tour! ************************************************************************************************ PRIVATE TOUR Here in Phuket with your squad or family? Enjoy a day of uninterrupted bonding at the private tour. With the given perk of having the entire vehicle to yourself, your local tour guide will be there to answer any queries you may have. Driving along the stretch of beaches, namely Patong, Karon, Kata and Rawai beach, you’ll see first-hand why many tourists and locals alike flock to the beaches first when in Phuket. One of the highlights during the tour would be a stop at the Old Town Phuket - a string of Sino-Portuguese colonial houses. Reminiscent of colonial house from yesteryears, many of them now function as shophouses. Here, you’ll see the deep influence the west has on Phuket and also, you snag a good deal of going to two countries in one trip! Another iconic landmark you’ll stop over at is the Wat Chalong temple - the most respected temple in the entire of Phuket. For the pious, you could take this opportunity to make a quick prayer; and if not, marvel the grandeur of this temple and also gain a deeper insight to the everyday lives of the locals. And since it’s a private tour, feel free to arrange with your tour guide to stop at any of the beaches to enjoy the sun, sand and waters. If you love to soak up the rays in a festive setting, definitely make a stop at Kata beach, a surfing paradise where adventure and fun are aplenty. With clear blue waters and powder-fine white sand, the beach is known for its cleanliness and vast expanse. If walking along the shoreline quietly as the waves crash is your idea of respite, then the Karon beach will have you swooning. A quieter beach that spells relaxation, regain a sense of zen from the bustle of the city before heading on back into the tour vehicle. The highlight of the tour would be a ride up to Karon Viewpoint - a deck above ground that offers you an unobstructed, panoramic view of the picturesque landscape. Overlooking three beaches all at once, this spot adopts a nickname of ‘three beaches viewpoint’ Here, be sure to grab some selfies. Trust us, even a random shot can look like a piece of art. The tour ends with sending you where you began - your hotel. But during the trip back, you’ll whizz past iconic landmarks and areas that are monumental to Phuket. And of course, your guide will fill you in with all the colourful details.
strTitle: Phuket Day Tour - Wat Chalong Temple and Phuket City Tour

strIntroduction: This walking tour will show you a side of Bangkok that most tourists don’t visit and provides a great insight into local life. On this tour, you walk along a stretch of the riverbank on the Thonburi side of the Chao Phraya river, where many original communities remain. As you walk you pass by Thai temples, Chinese shrines, churches and mosques. Yet, this is not a tour about religion, but rather one where we explore the diverse local cultures and the stories of how these groups arrived in the area. The tour starts at Saphan Taksin BTS. We will then take a boat to an area on the other side of the river. The tour continues with a walk down a street which is a foodies paradise. Here we will pick up local snacks to eat along the way. The tour then takes a combination of small backstreets and riverside paths as we pass by the Princess Mother's Memorial Park, Shrines, Mosques, and a Portuguese Catholic community famous for it's desserts. Finally, we'll arrive at the famous Wat Kalayanamit before heading back across the river where the tour will finish near the flower market. This walk is about 3.5km and suitable for anyone with moderate fitness. However, please remember it does get hot in Bangkok. The starting time varies throughout the year. During the winter months (still pretty hot!) the tour is in the afternoon but during summer months we run the tour in the morning when it is noticeably cooler.
strTitle: Feel Bangkok's Diversity & Harmony through a Walking Tour

strIntroduction: The Area - Phang Nga bay and James Bond island Thailand consists of 102 National parks, 21 of them are Marine National parks and Phang Nga national park is one of these marine parks. Each island in Phang Nga Bay has it’s particular shape, with its sea caves giving access to internal lagoons and small sandy beaches. It is a very well protected bay, therefore easy to navigate in calm water all year around. ***************************************************************************************** What to expect - A day on our big boat is filled with different activities which are a lot of fun for the whole family - Canoeing, sightseeing, swimming, relaxing, on-board entertainment - You will return to your hotel with the best of memories and amazing pictures. ***************************************************************************************** Why us? The main reason we are different than other operators is that we don’t over crowd people into our boat. By experience and by trying ourselves the tours on the other operators boats, we know how much better it is to sightsee and canoe in small groups. Our “big boat” can carry 55 persons but to make the trip very comfortable to every one, we will not take more than 20 per day. This means only 10 canoes at the time on the water, what you wouldn't have on a tour with up to 100 other people. We like to do anything we can to protect the nature, and going out with a small group of 20 persons for a minimal impact on the nature or recycling what we can on the boat just makes us feel good. Our team is also happy to collect any rubbish floating around. Each canoe has a paddle man. This person is responsible for it’s equipment and will be devoted to the same customers all day, like a “private” guide to take pictures for them, to inform them and make sure they have an excellent fun day out with us. We will pick you up early (between 6:30 and 7:20 am) so that you avoid the morning traffic and can appreciate the beauty of the areas without the main tourist crowds and our boat will leave the pier as soon as everyone gets on board. Unlike other companies, we do not have an office at the pier to make you wait for late arrivals. Also, we always keep track of our driver’s routes to make sure they all get to the boat on time. Whatever happens, our boat will leave at 8 am. (1 hour earlier than other companies) The main priority for us is that ALL of you have a great day and be safe! For instance, if there are signs of bad weather, we will call your hotel and cancel the trip. You can be assured that you are visiting Phang Nga bay on a safe boat with international standards and a very experienced and friendly crew. We are so confident that what we are giving to our customers is the best they can expect for regarding the price/quality ratio, so any “unhappy” customers will be entitled to get a full refund.
strTitle: Canoe around James Bond island in Phang Nga Bay

strIntroduction: This course comes with a special morning trip to the local markets selecting freshest ingredients for your cooking class experience. Pat will certainly go with you for teaching how to select the best ingredients and describing each and every element which make Thai cuisine deliciously unique. You have two options for this Private Dining Class : Option 1 - We will cook and dine in my airy, Western style home in Phuket-Town. Option 2 (Recommended!) - At My Balinese-Thai style bungalow, located on a mountain high above Phuket city with a great view of Phuket and Andaman Sea. You are welcome to bring your own drinks (E.g. Beer and/or Wine) Not all ingredients will be easy to find back at home - which is why I can suggest alternatives which can be substituted so that flavour and authenticity are not compromised. You can enjoy learning the art of Thai cooking and then savour it at home with your family and friends – it will be a ‘souvenir’ that you cherish for a lifetime from your trip to Thailand
strTitle: Get a Private Cooking Class on a Tropical Hillside in Phuket

strIntroduction: Start your underwater adventure with this three day course and become a PADI diver! This is where it all begins... The reefs south of Phi Phi are teaming with schools of colorful fish, turtles and sharks. A short boat ride from the main island takes you to the uninhabited islands for Phi Phi Ley and the Bida islands. Majestic cliffs covered in tropical foliage rise in to the blue sky with the rich reef systems start just below the surface and petering out 20 meters down. The PADI Open Water Diver course is built in three parts: Day 1 - Learn the basic theory of diving in the morning and the go down to the beach in the afternoon for confined water dives - Get comfortable with your scuba gear in shallow water and practice your new skills! Day 2 - Open Water Dives in the morning - Review what you learn in confined water and explore our luscious marine park. In the afternoon or evening you will finish the theory sections of the course. Day 3 - Back into the water for more open water dives to finish the course. Upon certification you will have a PADI Open Water Diver license, which is valid for life and will enable you to dive independently everywhere in the world.
strTitle: Join a Scuba Diving Open Water Course in Koh Phi Phi

strIntroduction: Arriving at the Bondi Aussie Bar & Grill in Patong you can enjoy a delicious burger and refreshing beer before meeting your tour group and guide. Departing from Patong at 2pm you will visit 3 great shopping locations. Stop 1: An astonishing emporium filled floor to ceiling with traditional Thai products, original artwork and furniture (that can be shipped home), striking souvenirs, clothes, jewellery and a whole lot more. Our guests receive a 30% discount off all items. Stop 2: The Premium Outlet Stores offer guaranteed brand-name clothing and sports accessories at bargain prices. Apart from Thai brands, other articles on sale include Lacoste, Guy Laroche, Hush Puppies, Warner Bros, Pierre Cardin, Van Heusen, Levi’s, Lee, Nautica, Adidas and Nike and feature discounts of up to 70%. Stop 3: Phuket's Weekend Night Market is not to be missed. You can find almost everything available on the island here and at MUCH cheaper prices! Even if you're not planning on buying anything, it's worth a visit for the authentic 'local' experience. The adventurous can also sample a huge range of local food. You're Thai/English speaking tour guide will be available throughout the tour to provide useful tips, cultural tidbits and assistance with bartering. Returning to Patong by 7pm you can kick on at Bondi Aussie Bar & Grill or retire to your hotel for a well earned rest and closer inspection of your purchases.
strTitle: Visit Phuket's Best Market

strIntroduction: This cooking class will be held in my home near Phuket town in an airy western style kitchen. This course comes with a special morning trip to the local markets, selecting freshest ingredients for your cooking class experience. I will certainly go with you and teach you how to select the best ingredients and describing each and every element which makes Thai cuisine deliciously unique. From the preparation of the ingredients right through the cooking process, to the best part – the eating – you will experience it all first hand. I will give you easy to follow recipes and a certificate upon completion! OUR MENU RANGE Currently, I teach in person the following recipes. Please let me know if you have any special requests! Starters / Entrees: Pod Priar Thord (Thai Spring Rolls) Som Tum (Papaya / Mango Salad) Tom Yum Kung Mains Kai Med Mamung Himapan (Chicken with Cashew Nuts) Tord Mun Pla (Fish Cakes) Kao Pad (Fried Rice) Pad Krakow Rad Kon (Spicy pork or chicken with holy basil) Pad Thai (Thai Fried Noodles) Laab Gai Moo (Spicy salad of minced pork or chicken) Kaeng Kiaow Wan Gai (Green Chicken Curry) Masamam Gai (Masamam Chicken) Panang Gai (Penang Chicken) Deserts: Kao Niaow Mamuang (Sticky Rice & Mango) Kluang Buad Shee (Banana/Mango/Pumpkin/Sweet Potato or Taro with coconut milk)
strTitle: Join a Home Cooking Class with a Master Chef from Phuket

strIntroduction: Have you ever wondered what it’s like to breathe underwater. If you want to find out but aren’t quite ready to take the plunge into a certification course, Discover Scuba Diving will let you try scuba to see if you like it. We will take you for 2 dives with a maximum dive time of 60min and a maximum depth of 12m. Our group size of 2 students to 1 instructor lets us give you fantastic personalized service with safety and fun the guiding principles. After learning the basic principles of diving from your PADI instructor we descend into shallow water to get comfortable in our new aquatic environment. Once your feeling happy underwater we swim along the gorgeous reef systems slowly descending to a maximum depth of 12 meters. Both dives are a maximum of 1 hour.
strTitle: Discover Scuba Diving in Koh Phi Phi

strIntroduction: We are a family-run property close to Bangkok, and we are passionate about allowing visitors to experience the authentic Thai way of life and learn about our local wisdom. This special 3 Day 2 Night trip we've created will let you enjoy the best of Thai culture on our grounds - you'll get a boat ride to our organic farm, enjoy picking ingredients for your dinner, watch our beloved elephants play, and finally pick up some skills at our arts & culture workshops. It's a fun and relaxing way to get to know Thai culture in 2 days! DAY ONE Once you arrive, we will meet and greet you at the hotel lobby for a short briefing after you check in at Sampran Riverside (check in time is from 14.00hrs) Late afternoon, take a short boat ride to our property’s very own certified Organic Farm. In the tranquil grounds of the farm, learn about the vegetables and herbs commonly used in Thai Cooking and pick these ingredients for your cooking class. Proceed to Ruen Ayudhaya, an antique Thai House amidst a herbal garden to have your traditional Thai cooking class. Learn the techniques and prepare 4 popular Thai dishes. Then enjoy your own cooked dishes for dinner and the chef will prepare 3 additional dishes. Overnight in Superior Garden View room DAY TWO Early morning, join the Alms Giving activity at one of our gardens Buffet breakfast at Rim Nam Restaurant. Participate in and enjoy our ‘Living The Thai Culture’ Art and Craft Workshops at the Thai Village. You are free to roam around and try out over 10 art and craft activities dotted around the village, each one in their own pavilion stations. Local villagers will be there to guide you in each activity. After buffet lunch, proceed to watch a brief elephant demonstration followed by the Thai Village Cultural show, which is the longest daily running show in Thailand. Live traditional Thai music accompanies the performance that highlights the Thai way of life, reflected through everyday activities, festivals and traditional celebrations. Overnight in Superior Garden View room DAY THREE Buffet breakfast at Rim Nam Restaurant Check out from Sampran Riverside (check out time is 12.00hrs or before) THE STORY OF OUR BEAUTIFUL COMMUNITY: Once upon a time... actually just over 50 years ago, the first governor of Bangkok Dr. Chamnan Yuvaboon was looking for a holiday home outside of Bangkok and discovered a bullet wood tree by the river banks that was about to topple over. To save this tree he bought the land and built their family's holiday home. The sacred bullet-wood tree still stands here today within the 70-acre property that is now known as Sampran Riverside. Initially, the business had started as cultivating roses to supply to the Bangkok flower markets which had come from a passion the governor's wife had developed during her visit to England. Since then, under the care of three generations, Sampran Riverside has grown gradually to a 70-acre riverside property that is more like a community rather than a ‘typical’ resort.
strTitle: Experience True Thai Culture in 3 days
