strTitle: Live the Thai Culture on a 2D1N getaway: Cooking Class & Art

strIntroduction: Sampran Riverside is a half a century old family-run property about an hour drive from Bangkok. All gardens and the 10-acre farm at the property are certified organic which came after over 7 years of hard work when we first started to venture out in organic agriculture together with the local community. Upon arrival, we meet at the hotel lobby for a short briefing before we begin the adventure. Itinerary for the day 10.00-11.30hrs Begin the culinary adventure with a short boat ride across the river to our property’s very own organic farm which is certified organic to IFOAM and EU standards. In the tranquil grounds of the farm, learn about the vegetables and herbs commonly used in Thai cooking and pick these ingredients for your cooking class. Also sample homemade herbal teas and sample season fresh fruits. 11.30-12.30hrs Proceed to an antique Thai house amidst a certified organic herbal garden to start your Thai cooking class. Learn the techniques from a local experienced chef and prepare 4 popular Thai dishes: ‘Khanom Pang Na Moo’ Minced pork on toast, ‘Som Tam’ Raw Papaya Salad, ‘Kai Yang’ Grilled Chicken, and ‘Tom Yam Kung’ Lemongrass Soup with Prawns. 12.30-13.30hrs Proceed to Inn Chan Restaurant to enjoy your own cooked dishes and the chef will prepare 3 additional dishes for a full course Thai set lunch (food only): Stir-fried Organic Morning Glory with Chili and Garlic, Massaman Curry with Beef and Stir-fried Chicken with Cashew Nuts. Steamed Jasmine Rice and Coffee/Tea are included in the meal. 13.30-14.15hrs Free time to take a leisurely walk through our chemical-free botanical gardens and explore a variety of native species of herbs and flowers including organic roses. All our gardens are certified organic to IFOAM and EU standards. Some time for shopping for handmade handicrafts and local souvenirs or elephant riding until the starting time for the Thai Cultural Show. 14.15-14.30hrs Elephant Demonstration After the Thai cultural show, watch a short elephant demonstration to learn actual facts about these wonderful giant creatures in Thailand 14.45-15.30hrs Thai Village Cultural Show Relax and take a seat in an air-conditioned auditorium to enjoy the longest running daily show in Thailand. Live traditional Thai music accompanies the performance that highlights the Thai way of life, reflected through everyday activities, festivals and traditional celebrations. Highlights include: Buddhist ordination ceremony, Muay Thai (Thai boxing), typical Thai wedding ceremony, sword fighting and fast paced bamboo dancing.
strTitle: Pick Ingredients at an Organic Farm and Cook a Thai Meal

strIntroduction: Volunteer at a temple in the deep Thai forest will be the most unforgettable experience. You will help local people, assist in repairing the temple, and plant trees. Qualification: Aged between 15 and 19 years old.
strTitle: Volunteer at a Temple in Thailand

strIntroduction: Buddha View Dive Resort Japanese team was found by two instructors in 1999, and today we serve many customers as a long-established diving store on Tao island. Our six instructors, videographers and a couple divemasters guide customers through the fascinating ocean of Tao island. All our diving and fan diving courses take small groups only; one instructor takes a maximum of four customers at the same time to ensure the safety of our patrons. We want to have fun and yet still prioritise our customers' safety. At Buddha View, customer do not only enjoy diving but also snorkeling, wakeboarding, sauna, spa, drinking and cooking. Such fun times make people stay here longer and keep returning to Buddha View on Tao island. Contents: Open water licence course Advanced open water licence course (There is 1+2 discount course as well) Fandiving (Only for who has license) We would like everyone to see the beauty of Tao island! photo by: http://www.flickr.com/photos/saspotato/3958138723/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/volk/1284954095/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/michaelaston/176951909/ http://www.flickr.com/photos/48089670@N00/282282410/
strTitle: Take a Whale Shark diving tour in Koh Tao

strIntroduction: Phuket Photo Tours' favorites all in one! This photo tour with a professional photographer will take you to our favorite and most secret places. You will visit the Big Bhudda and be amazed by its huge size. Then you will spend some time with Phuket's last true inhabitants at the Sea Gypsies Village where you will enjoy taking pictures of the local kids who are all but camera shy! And finally, you will get to the best place on the island for some stunning pictures of the sunset. Our professional photographer is there to help you capture wonderful pictures or simply to help take the pictures for you.
strTitle: Take a sunset tour in Phuket

strIntroduction: Phuket Photo Tours offers you a unique opportunity to explore Phuket's Buddhist heritage. With this tour you will be accompanied by a professional photographer who will guide you at Phuket's main places of worship. You will start at the Big Buddha where you will be amazed by the huge size of this Buddha image.Then you will visit Phuket main Buddhist temple at Chalong and admire this colourfull traditional Thai temple. And finally, you will walk the streets of the old quarter of Phuket Town to discover the Chinese shrines built more than hundred years ago by the Chinese immigrants established in Phuket as tin merchants. The photographer will help you capture your best holiday pictures ever or you can also let him/her take the pictures of you and you will receive a CD with all the day's photos.
strTitle: Explore Phuket's Buddhist heritage
Take a bike tour through Koh Yao Noi

strIntroduction: Thai Muang is a small Thai coastal town on the Andaman Coast in between Phuket and Khao Lak, despite having great coast line, deserted beaches, National Parks and waterfalls in the vicinity it is very much over looked by the mass tourists; most people simply bypass the area moving between Khao Lak and Phuket. It is the quiet, unhurried pace of life in this small Thai town and the nearby villages that attracted Amazing Bike Tours to select the area for one of our Thailand Biking day trips. The location of this day trip makes it the perfect Biking choice for guests staying in Phuket Island. With the exception of the final few kilometers being on a dirt and gravel track the rest of the Cycling is on roads in good conditions. We Bike across Sarasin Bridge and after a few kilometers we leave the main road and Cycle along small country roads, perfect for Biking due to very little traffic. The morning ride is a total of 30KM on flat terrain. After lunch in a beach side restaurant and a visit to a Sea Turtle Sanctuary we bike another 15km to a waterfall. The afternoon ride is on road with a few gentle hills thrown in. This Bike tour is followed through out the day by our Mini bus, if at any point any of our guests are tired they can jump in the bus and still enjoy the same views as everyone else.
strTitle: Catch a glimpse of the Thai Muang turtles & waterfalls

strIntroduction: In this tour, with Japanese guide you can see Angkor Wat in Cambodia which is the World Heritage and Beng Mealea which is a good place not many tourist know about. Angkor Wat is the place attracts many tourists. Hindu creation myth and many gods drawn on wall painting in the heritage get attentions from people and take them to a mysterious world. Besides you can see Ta Prohm and Angkor Thom which are the two of the three remains in Angkor Wat. Another attractive spot is Beng Mealea. But this is the popular place for Japanese because this is said to be the model of the film "Castle in the sky" by Hayao Miyazaki. In this place there are still mines. So you can learn about the history of the war by guide. At night time, also you can experience the atmosphere of old markets and towns in Siem Reap. *Tour content 1st day (Early morning) Leave in Bangkok Khaosan (Evening) Arrive in Cambodia Siem Reap. 2nd day (Morning) Sightseeing in Angkor Thom and Ta Prohm (Afternoon) Watching sunset in Angkor Wat 3rd day (Morning~Afternoon) Sightseeing in Beng Mealea (Evening) Sightseeing in Old market 4th day (Early morning) Leave in Cambodia Siem Reap (Evening) Arrive in Bangkok Khaosan We also give you optional tours.(ex：three days and two nights plan)
strTitle: 4 days Angkor Wat Castle in the Sky Beng Mealea

strIntroduction: Activities: Day 1: You will get pick up by 8.00 - 8.30 a.m. from the hotel or the guest house where you stay. After get pick up we will drive to a local market for buy a fresh fruits (banana, watermelon, sugarcane) for feeding to elephants. After that we will drive about 1 hour to Mhong tribal village. The guide will give you all information about the tribal culture, lifestyle and the history. You can spend the time to walk around the village. And then we will start walking through the beautiful jungle from Mhong village to our elephant camp take about 4 hours, on the way we walking we will take it easy stop along the way to enjoy the nature, views and also find some herbs using for elephant and stop at waterfall to relax or swimming. We will be arriving to the camp around 4 p.m. We will relax by Thai traditional massage from local people. Dinner and overnight at our elephant camp with mahouts. At night we can enjoy chatting, singing and playing games. Day 2: We will have breakfast at the camp. After breakfast and relax we will meeting the stuff and the trainer will give you the mahout set, let you change clothes to be the mahout clothes. After that we familiarize with the elephant by feed them some fruits. Next the trainer will give information all about elephants. After that we will start the introduction of mahout training course. In the course you will learn in basic elephant language, how to control and riding, you will be trained to ride on its neck by using many different techniques. After that is the time for lunch, after lunch and relax the trainer will let you control your elephant by yourself to the river (1 elephant for 2 people).Also enjoy bath and brush your elephant. And you must to adventure ride elephant bare back follow river by scenic walk with open views of the surrounding hills as well as the fields of local people. And then take elephant to the mud pool, you can enjoy take a mud bath with elephant as you wish. After at the mud pool, you will also learn to re- plant food for the elephants to ensure a sustainable food supply for the elephants. After relax, have some picture memory and say goodbye to Mahouts and all lovely elephants. After that we short drive to the rafting camp to get experience on bamboo rafting for 1 hour. Then we drive back arriving to Chiang Mai around 5.30 p.m.
strTitle: 2 Days 1 Night Trek&Experience Mahout training in Chiang Mai

strIntroduction: If you do lure fishing in Thailand, you may want to bait some "Lates Calcarifer", which is popular among Thai’s known angler population. A big one measures about 1 meter and weighs approximately 10 kg. If you are a beginner, we will welcome you because it is so easy to fish. You can easily fish and have fun with your family, friends and your partner. The more people you invite, the more discounts you can get. You will need consultation if there are over 7 participants. We will provide you with transport to your accommodation in Bangkok. It is a great opportunity to fish abroad! Come and join us!
strTitle: Take a one-of-its-kind fishing trip in Thailand

strIntroduction: The elephant trek offers the worldwide unique possibility to be with elephants for more than a whole week. You will ride your own elephant up to 8 hours a day. On the way to our destination you will spend the nights in tents (that are provided) in the forests of Northern Thailand. While riding you will be able to enjoy the great landscape: High mountains will be passed as well as wonderful rivers, isolated villages and lively cities. This tour is really suitable for adventurous people, and marks, because of being so unique, one of the highlights in our offered program. ____________ 8 days en route (daily distance about 20km/ 12 miles): April: Home-Trek - the elephants are being brought to their home villages for vacation June: Back-to-work-Trek - the new season starts, the elephants are coming back to our camp December: Around-the-Valley-Trek - start and finish of the trek is our elephant camp ____________ Asia's 'elephant-culture' is thousands of years old. When the logging ban was introduced in Thailand most elephants became unemployed overnight. Tourism is the only alternative for the people of northern Thailand to continue working with these magnificent animals in order to ensure this giant's survival, as well as an income for their owners. Our approach is to bring you close to these grey giants and Thailand's culture of elephant keeping. Sitting in the neck of the majestic creatures you will learn how to ride and control your elephant while riding through the beautiful mountains of northern Thailand, or having a bath together in the jungle's bath tub. Along the way you will learn about Thailand's local hill tribe life and its thousands of years old culture. During your stay you will be guided by Bodo Jens Förster and his team of European and Asian employees. We very much rely on this concept since elephants are only happy if they can enjoy a familiar social structure. Every elephant is taken care of by a qualified Mahout, who will guide you during your stay.
strTitle: Camp, trek and enjoy Thailand's beauty with elephants

strIntroduction: The Training Trip is perfectly suited for persons who have always dreamed about getting to know elephants, but who also want to experience other wonderful adventures in Thailand. Within just two days you will get to know the most important aspects of elephant keeping in Thailand and you will also learn how to ride your own grey giant along the mountain trails of Northern Thailand. Asia's 'elephant-culture' is thousands of years old. When the logging ban was introduced in Thailand most elephants became unemployed overnight. Tourism is the only alternative for the people of northern Thailand to continue working with these magnificent animals in order to ensure this giant's survival, as well as an income for their owners. strIntroduction: A Day You Will Never Forget For many of you this will be your first jump! So, we have listed below a few details of what to expect when you arrive and to give you an idea of how long you will be with us. Upon arrival, we will weigh you so we can prep the bungy, if you want to be dunked in the water now is the time to tell us!! Safety and Harness: Our harness straps to your ankles, one of our jump masters will ensure you are secure before going up to 50 metres! Jump Time Our jump cage is a sliding lift attached to the crane shaft, it is not suspended on a wire and gradually climbs up to maximum jump height. And Finally, JUMP!... of course we can give you a nudge if you like! Once you get to the bottom you can collect your Certificate Of Courage! Skilled Professional operate all our different types of Bungy: Bungy Jump Tandem Bungy Catapult Bungy Backwards Bungy Water Touch Bungy
strTitle: Take a leap - bungy-jumping in Phuket
Experience Thai culture with the locals

strIntroduction: “Colors of Bangkok” is a 4-5 hour bicycle excursion through the metropolis Bangkok. The trip will start twice daily, 08:00 & 13:00 hrs from Rama 3 Road Soi 71. During this trip, which holds a maximum of 8 people per group, participants get to see the diversity this metropolis has to offer. We take you through a part of the Thai capital which you will never see on your own. A part where there is almost no traffic, just narrow streets and backyards. Bangkok as you have never imagined! After a quick bicycle fitting we start with our Bangkok bicycle adventure. During the first part of the tour we see stand alone villas, luxurious apartment buildings, town houses and in between shops, companies and small factories. We make a first stop at one of the many hidden local communities in Bangkok. We might call it a slum, but the local people call it ‘home’. The people who live here belong to the poorest people in Bangkok, but they are very friendly, polite and generous and give us a warm welcome every day. We walk through this small community and stop at the slum kindergarten. The very poorest children receive education here while their parents are working. We continue our bicycle adventure in the ‘City of Angels’ and make a stop at a sweatshop before we arrive at the pier. Here we board a typical Thai longtail boat to cross the mighty Chao Phraya river. At the other side of the river we find ourselves back in the ‘Jungle’ or the ‘Green Lung’ of Bangkok, the greenest area in the city. We cycle on elevated pathways through lush vegetation and in the shade of coconut palms and banana trees. Halfway the tour we stop at a local restaurant and provide a small Thai meal, Pad Thai (Thai noodles) or Khao Pad (fried rice). After our meal we visit a very old, non-touristy Buddhist temple. The guide will tell you everything about this temple and about Buddhism in general. Unfortunately, time has come to return to the pier where we take a short boat ride back to the hustle and bustle of Bangkok again. But before we arrive at our office/lounge we make a last stop at an open-air Muay Thai school. Muay Thai, or Thai Boxing, is the national sport and cultural martial art of Thailand and its origin dates back several hundred years. Participants on our Colors of Bangkok bicycle tour will learn and see how daily life passes by for Bangkokians. While we want to make this tour enjoyable, your safety is our top priority. Therefore, we highly recommend that only those who are fit and able to ride bicycles take part in this tour. Note: We reserve the right to change advertised itineraries, since schools and local shops may be closed during the weekend, school holidays and national holidays.
strTitle: See the sights and sounds of Bangkok on a bike

strIntroduction: このツアーでは、チェンマイの首長族とカレン族を訪れ、３泊４日のホームステイを体験することができます。 タイにはたくさんの民族がありますが、彼らは山の中にある村で生活をし、独自の文化を築いているため、旅行者にとって自分だけで足を踏み入れることはなかなか難しいかもしれません。しかし、ここではホームステイで現地の人々と交流し、タイ北部の自然を満喫することができます。 このツアーでは、チェンライ・ミャンマー国境を冒険します。首長族・カレン族のホームステイや、山岳民俗が住む村、活気のある市場の訪問、伝統ある茶館、バンドゥー温泉、国立公園、フイケオ滝、チェンダオ洞窟、タートン寺、コーヒー畑の広がるドイ・チャーン山など、たった４日間で自然体験と現地交流を思いっきり楽しんでいただきます。鳥肌のたつような名所を巡り、現地の村を訪れホームステイをし、文化に触れ、チェンライの美しい自然・現地人の温かい心に触れ合うことがこのツアーの醍醐味です。 あなたが今まで見た事のない、経験したことのない素晴らしい世界があなたを待っています。 3泊4日ツアーのスケジュールです。 1日目： チェンマイにてピックアップ →メースアイ →ドイ・チャーン山（アカ、リス族） →ドイ・ワーウィー（カレン族） →ラオリー →マイモックチャーン →ご希望でバンドゥー温泉 →首長族の村でホームステイ 2日目： 首長族の村 →アカ族・パヒー村 →コーヒー畑 →ドイチャンムーブ/タイミャンマー国境（タイ・ミャンマー国境警備軍駐屯所） →メーサロンの茶畑 →山岳民族の開く市場 →台湾式茶芸館（中国茶の試飲） →首長族の村でホームステイ 3日目： 首長族の村 →国立公園 →ラフ族の村 →アカ族の村 →フイケオ滝 →茶畑・ジンホー族の村 →温泉 →カレン族ガイド宅でホームステイ 4日目： カレン族ガイド宅 →ヤオ族の村 →アカ族の村 →タートン寺 →ラフ族の村 →ヒノキアロマオイル →チェンダオ洞窟 →チェンマイまでお送り 3泊4日で食事つき、完全プライベートツアーでいたれりつくせりの内容です。 是非この機会に現地の人と触れ合いながら、タイを思いっきり楽しんでみませんか？ ご連絡をお待ちしております！ 写真元： http://flic.kr/p/b3hUkv http://flic.kr/p/6FXSfq http://flic.kr/p/9KxaxB http://flic.kr/p/5RP7Lc http://flic.kr/p/64sCUL http://flic.kr/p/su5AV
strTitle: チェンマイの首長族でホームステイ＆自然を楽しむ体験（３泊４日）

strIntroduction: ***************************************************************************************** What to expect - A day on our big boat is filled with different activities which are a lot of fun for the whole family - Canoeing, sightseeing, swimming, relaxing, - You will return to your hotel with the best of memories and amazing pictures. ***************************************************************************************** ITINERARY 10.00 Hotel pick-up by the A/C minibus or bus 11.00 Arrive at Ao por pier, North east of Phuket, Depart for Phang Nga bay, Safety instruction. 12.30 Arrive Phang-Nga Bay, Paddle and explore the 2 most famous islands, enter caves 20 – 150 m. (dark, long) Visit lagoons, sight-seeing James Bond Island, Buffet lunch served on board. 15.30 Depart for Lawa Island. 16.30 Arrive Lawa Island,Leisure as your own wishes on the beach, self paddling etc. 17.30 Depart for Ao por pier and transfer to hotel. 19.00 Arrival at hotel ***************************************************************************************** Phang-Nga Bay belongs to the Andaman Sea, which in turn belongs to the mighty Indian Ocean. In the bay one will find 42 island and islets.; All are beautiful but a few are truly spectacular because of their shape, the outside stalactites, their fantastic caves and lagoons with mangroves inside. The islands in this amazing bay, which you always see by flying in or by take off from the International Airport of Phuket, are a real non-classified world-wonder. Such a landscape you only can admire at Phang-Nga Bay (the most beautiful), Krabi and Surat Thani provinces in Thailand, Guilin in Southern China, Halong Bay (near Da Nang) in Vietnam, Vieng Vang in Laos and Sarawak on the island of Borneo. To enter the sea caves ( the “Hong”) is one of the most beautiful experiences you can imagine. An untouched world, created by nature through million of years If you tour with us, you will see that we - - Limit the number of tourists we take to Hongs - Use only fully educated guides, approved by The - Tourism Authority of Thailand - Employ local people with deep knowledge and understanding of the sea. - Make sure to remind our guests of the golden rules of the nature’s vistor - Don’t touch anything - Don’t take anything - Don’t leave anything
strTitle: Canoe and Cruise around Phang Nga Bay

strIntroduction: ITINERARY 06:45 Transfer from Hotel 07:30 Cruising from Phuket 08:00 Breakfast on board 10:30 Refreshments and small presentation on Phi Phi 11:30 Phi Phi - snorkelling, swimming and sun! 13:45 Lunch on board 14:30 Cruising around Marine Park, Phi Phi, & Viking Cave 15:00 Maya Bay - stunning lagoon as featured in the movie "The Beach" 15:15 Cruising to Phuket 16:00 Refreshments on board 16:30 Presentation - Thailand's customs and traditions 17:30 Transfer to Hotel ************************************************************************************************ PHI PHI ISLANDS AND MAYA BAY - Some say that the beauty of the Phi Phi Islands is unrivalled in all of South East Asia. While that point can be argued, the crystal clear, turquoise waters surrounded by towering, jagged, limestone cliffs justify Maya Bay's legendary status around the world. It's no coincidence that it was chosen as Leonardo Di Caprio's island escape in the Hollywood blockbuster - "The Beach." Unfortunately, Maya Bay is so beautiful that it brings in crowds from all over the world. This is why our tour tries to arrive when most boats have left, and we visit snorkelling spots that are not on most classic itineraries from other providers, allowing our guests to avoid the hordes of people otherwise present in the area. There are still fantastic coral reefs to snorkel above, and we'll take you there! ************************************************************************************************ THE BOAT - **MV CHAMPAGNE** Relax. Lounge. Savour. We at La Moet are really proud of our very own boat, MV Champagne. She’s in many ways a dream come true. After renting a boat during La Moet's first four years, we decided we wanted something a little more personal, something with a little more quality. So we decided to buy a traditional fishing boat in the Autumn of 2010 - and rebuilt her from hull to top. To say that our blood sweat and tears showed its results would be an understatement - Today we look at Champagne with immense joy. A 20 meter long beautiful, wooden vessel that has all the amenities one could wish for. Cozy living areas both indoors and outdoors, open space with panoramic ocean views, a large sundeck with lovely seating and lounging areas with comfy backrests and cushions, modern bathrooms are backed up by a wonderful vibe. On our tours, the boat is not a means of transport, but an incredibly imperative and popular part of the experience. We cruise at a pace where one actually has time to savour in the stunning surroundings. Aboard MV Champagne, you have time to socialize, relax and make new friends. Aboard MV Champagne, you can leave all your troubles behind. Sail with us for an experience you'll never forget! ************************************************************************************************ THE FOOD We have our own kitchen on board and receive daily compliments on the food and drinks served. Our in-house chef prepares delicious, fresh Thai meals that so many of of guests can't get enough of! Top that off with irresistible pancakes. Although this is in no way a 'party boat', beer, wine and champagne can be purchased on board. No one, ever, leaves our tours hungry or thirsty. ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: Phuket Day Tours to Maya Bay: La Moet's Phi Phi Island Tour

strIntroduction: At the Safari Park in Bo Phloi, the winds of change are in the air. Be part of this exciting transitional stage and contribute your time to improving the animal welfare at the park and setting the standard for the rest of Thailand. Your day will involve feeding, grooming and socialising baby leopard, tiger and/or lion cubs followed by an elephant ride through the jungle (optional extra) to the nearby river where you can swim and water fight with the fun loving mahouts. You can also fed the elephants yummy banana treats and get to know each of their distinct personalities. Afterwards create toys and puzzles for the monkeys and learn how to accurately record the results. You will then clean out our Binturong enclosure and hand feed them under the supervision of our friendly and knowledgeable long term volunteers who can answer all your questions and teach you about each animal. Next you will enter the Big Cat Garden where you can chose which Big Cat you would like to have photos with. These cats are approximately 8 - 16 months and are very well trained using only positive reinforcement! Meet and train and photograph the tigers, lions and leopards from inside their enclosure! You will also learn how to target train with the Langur monkey and get a chance to feed gibbons and several species of macaques. Each one has their own likes, dislikes and behaviours and it won't take you long to fall in love with your favourite monkey! You can also play with and feed our friendly macaw parrots who love to sit on your shoulders - especially Captain Joey! After this you can relax in the comfort of our Safari Bus as we take you around various enclosures where you can get up close and person with lions, tigers and bears and hand feed giraffe, zebra and deer. Guaranteed to be the best photos of your trip! After Safari you can hang out in the park to explore the natural surroundings or just to meet our keepers as they carry out their day routines. If you are lucky you might even get the chance to walk a jackal or two! A truly once in a lifetime experience that you will never forget. We have extremely limited availability!
strTitle: Volunteer as a zoo keeper

strIntroduction: Enjoy the experience of a lifetime: see where the movie ‘The Beach’ was filmed, and then sleep under the stars on your own private boat. If you visit Maya Bay during the day, you will be up against a horde of day-trippers hell bent on the cliché, but if you join our live aboard tour, you will have an unforgettable experience that you will recall with a smile for the rest of your life. We leave Phi Phi Don from the ferry pier at 3 pm and return the next day at 10:00 am. On the way to Phi Phi Ley (weather permitting), we stop to see the Viking Caves, followed by a snorkeling session, and some fresh fruit for afternoon tea. We arrive at Maya Bay before sunset. If you are a strong swimmer and feeling ambitious, you can jump into the water and swim to shore, or if you prefer, you can ride to shore on a long tail boat or in a kayak. Now it’s time to sit back, relax, and watch as the beach becomes clear of day trippers. Soon the beach becomes just ours to enjoy! Our own cook comes with us and prepares for a Thai feast or Penang curry, mixed vegetables and oyster sauce and boiled rice. For vegetarians we cook your own special meal on the boat. We have an area set aside with lanterns, IPOD speakers, and a bar which offers drinks for sale at reasonable prices. Take the time to connect with your fellow travellers from all over the world. Everyone gets 1 free bucket (local drinking habit consisting of Thai rum and coke), which along with some music usually gets the party started. Around 10 pm a delicious chicken BBQ and garlic bread is served. After supper, many people choose to take a moonlight swim in the tranquil waters. At 11:00 o'clock we head back to the boat. We will be moored 150 meters off the beach in Maya bay in high season and in Losama Bay 30 meters from the rear entrance to Maya Bay in low season. Sleeping bags, pillows, and mattresses are provided. Most people prefer to sleep on the top deck under the starlit skies as this adds to the whole experience. With no light pollution in the sky, shooting stars are plentiful. If it does rain, we have a covered deck area as well. No mosquitoes or creepy crawlies. In the morning we wake up soon after sunrise and head back into the beach for some morning photo opportunities. Sit on the beach all by yourself or go for a swim. Around 8:00 am we head back to the boat and serve a breakfast with coffee, tea, eggs, toast, and fruit. After breakfast jump into the water for some more snorkeling along the caves around the bay and the small deserted beaches that are normally inaccessible. We arrive back at Phi Phi Don by 10 am, usually very tired - but very, very happy.
strTitle: Sleep Aboard Maya Bay & Swim with Glowing Plankton

strIntroduction: Would you like to explore the most photogenic parts of Thailand's capital city in the company of an experienced professional photographer? Gavin Gough is a travel photographer, living and working in Bangkok. You are invited to join him for a practical photo workshop, where you will have an opportunity to photograph some of Bangkok's lively and colourful street markets. Suitable for photographers of all levels, from complete beginners to experienced professionals, the workshop will not only give you an insight into local life, taking you away from the usual tourist destinations but you will be able to practice various photographic techniques, ensuring that you are fully equipped with the skills required to produce consistent quality in your photographs. The workshop is very much a practical exercise and my aim is to help you build a structured approach to your street photography. We’ll discuss the technical aspects of photography and ensure that you are making the most of your camera equipment. Just as importantly, we will explore the ideas and approaches to street photography that I have developed over the years and I’ll share my philosophy with you.
strTitle: Learn the art of street photography in Bangkok

strIntroduction: Experience Thailand's national sport with the best professional Muay Thai trainers in the world. In Muay Thai, the hands, shins, elbows, and knees are all used extensively. The origins of Muay Thai come from Muay Boran, which was the type of weaponless combat used by Siamese soldiers hundreds of years ago. Our camp has a total of almost 40 professional Muay Thai instructors who are current and former champions. The program we offer is open to all levels. Not only will you learn Muay Thai, you will also gain new friends from different parts of the world. You also get to share this amazing experience with professional fighters who are more than happy to teach you and also learn from you. Experience the art of eight limbs in the beautiful island of Phuket, Thailand where our camp is located conveniently close to the best beaches in the world.
strTitle: Kick-ass with Muay Thai & MMA

strIntroduction: Do you like Thailand? Do you like Thai people and their culture? If you answered yes, then surely you'd like to learn the beautiful Thai language as well. In this activity I'll provide you with an effective and interesting full day lesson on speaking Thai. The teachers are university students. Obviously, it's impossible to learn a new language in a day but you'll be able to understand the essence of the language and memorize some useful words and phrases. Come join us for a chit chat in Thai!
strTitle: Pickup Conversational Thai

strIntroduction: This tour covers sightseeing with Thai college students who learn Japanese. You can see a different side of Bangkok, having conversations with locals and share ideas. This activity is only available for college students or those in their twenties.
strTitle: Touring Bangkok with college students learning Japanese

strIntroduction: Go snorkeling and visit Pileh Bay and Viking caves before arriving at Maya Bay, where you will have time to explore the island. Sit on the beach and watch the other boats leave as Maya Bay slowly. After sunset we head back to the boat to enjoy a BBQ dinner on board. We will serve fresh fish and fried rice and we also cater for vegetarians. When nightfall approaches, you will have the opportunity to snorkel the amazing bio-luminescent plankton. See the incredible underwater light show, right in front of your eyes. Jump off our boat and watch the colors of the water shimmer and dance! To get the most out of this tour you need to go in the water with a mask on. You can see the bio-luminescence sitting on the boat or by dangling your feet in the water. However if you hop in the water with a mask only then will you see the psychedelic light show at is best. If you are not a strong swimmer don't worry. Put on a life jacket, hold on to one of our kayaks and put your head in the water. Conquer your fear; it will be worth it! Why should you choose our tour? There are many other Sunset tours on Phi Phi but we are unique because: • We leave Phi Phi at 3:00 pm and arrive at our destinations as the other tour boats are leaving. Sit in Maya Bay and watch the day-tripping crowds leave! • We have a 15 meter cruiser with music facilities (bring your IPOD!), and plenty of sun baking and shady areas. Our cruiser has a toilet and fresh water shower on board. Don’t get stuck ona crowded long tail boat. What's included: • National Park entry fee • Masks Fins and Snorkels • Kayaks • Fruit and Water • BBQ dinner on the boat
strTitle: Swim with Glowing Plankton

strIntroduction: Our first stop is at one of the “hongs” (lagoons) where we have a swim stop where you can jump from the boat if you like or relax on the sundeck and be amazed by the breath taking scenery, vertical limestone cliff, mangrove trees and wildlife. Your lunch will be served on board while we continue to cruise among the many islands, Phang Nga bay consists of 42 islands and we have many options where we can stop for a refreshing swim. This is a laidback day, were we cruise through the bay discovering unspoiled beaches in a unique landscape. It will both thrill and amaze you, Phang nga bay has an almost mysterious aura; this is truly a rewarding day. Phang nga bay information: A national park since 1981, Phang nga is famous for its amazing views of literally hundreds of vertical limestone cliffs rising over the sea , some of them reaching up to 300 meters out of the emerald-green water with caves leading in to stunning lagoons. Many of the limestone cliffs have beautiful stalactites and stalagmites that been created over thousands of years. In the bay there is at least 28 species of mangrove, 88 birds species, and 82 fish species amongst coral reefs. Some 10 000 years ago when sea level were lower one could walk from Phuket to Krabi trough the bay, today we need a boat to get in between the villages/Islands.
strTitle: Phang Nga Bay Cruise Champagne: Island Cruiser

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exciting day in the shade filled with fun challenges and see the best view of Koh Phi Phi Island from high above! South of the pier, Tonsai Tower dominates the horizon with its majestic formations. Whilst climbing its face-wall, you will enjoy an amazing view of the island! During a half or full day you will learn the basics of climbing in a fun and safe environment. We are the most experienced climbing company on the tropical island of Koh Phi Phi. Our climbing instructors are trained to the highest safety standards. No experience is required to do our introductory climbing course. The Details of our activities are as follows - Half Day + Full Day Our introductory climbing classes are designed for beginners and intermediate climbers who want to learn new skills in a safe yet challenging environment. You will decide, along with your instructor, exactly what you want to get out of your day with us. ********************************************************************************* Lead Climbing Full Day Advanced courses are private, FULL DAY and will teach you all the necessary skills to be safe and independent climber. If you want to continue to climb when you leave Phi Phi or learn to climb without a guide, these courses are for you! ********************************************************************************** Multi-Pitch Climbing Course Multi-pitch climbing is the ascent of a wall or tower with one or more stops at a belay station. Learn abseiling, advanced belaying techniques and anchor and rope management. ********************************************************************************** Deep Water Solo Deep Water Solo is the most natural form of climbing. We go to an area with deep water and steep rock and climb right of the boat. There are no ropes and anchors, only you and the beautiful Thai limestone. Climb hard problems close to the water or head straight up an easier route for a 20 meter jump! ********************************************************************************** Full Day Package - Deep Water Solo + Fun Climbing Rock climbing: 4 hours You will learn the basics of climbing in a fun and safe environment. Deep Water Solo: 3 hours The most natural form of climbing. We go to an area with deep water and steep rock and climb right out of the boat. There are no ropes and anchors. Snorkeling: See Marine life and Coral. We are snorkeling near area for deep water solo. ********************************************************************************** Three Day Course This is our most personal and in depth course. Beginners will get a large base of knowledge to start their life as a rock climber and climbers with prior experience will gain a wealth of knowledge and add new techniques to their repertoire. We will cover everything in the Lead Climbing and Multi-pitch courses as well as self techniques. **********************************************************************************
strTitle: Rock Climb on Koh Phi Phi's Natural Limestones

strIntroduction: Follow us as we go on an adventurous journey around Phi Phi Don and Phi Phi Ley Islands! See a real shark in Long Beach! Feed and play with monkeys on Monkey Beach! We will stop in front of a viking cave for funky photos while we learn about the history of the island. After that, spend an hour swimming and snorkeling in the amazing Pi-Leh Lagoon. We will pass through Loh Samah Bay to reach Maya Bay, the best place for swimming and relaxing with an unforgettable view. Our last stop will be at Palong Bay where you can watch sea turtles! Take a step into paradise with use and bring home memories for a lifetime.
strTitle: Snorkel and See Sea Turtles & Sharks in Phi Phi

strIntroduction: Koh Phi Phi is a archipelago comprising 5 islands. Join us on a full day tour to explore all the sights and scenes that Phi Phi has to offer! Starts 9:00am - 19:30pm Some highlights include: -Watching sharks at Long Beach -Snorkeling at Mosquito Island -Relaxing and swimming at beautiful Bamboo Island -Seeing corals and fishes at Rantee Bay -Playing with monkeys at Monkey Beach -Jump from an 18m high cliff Choose to jump from a cliff up to 18 metres high and snorkel with colourful fish around the tropical island of Koh Phi Phi Lay. -Snorkel with colorful fish around Koh Phi Phi Lay - Unwind on Maya Bay (The Beach) and take in the stunning views whilst eating lunch. -Watching the sunset from a boat -Taking a night swim with glowing plankton Take a step into paradise and take home memories for a lifetime.
strTitle: Join a Full Day Tour Around Phi Phi Archipelago

strIntroduction: Koh Phi Phi is an archipelago of 5 islands in Krabi, Thailand. We invite you to join us in discovering 2 of the islands in the northern region - Bamboo Island and Mosquito Island! Look forward to: -Watching sharks at long beach (depending on the weather) -Snorkeling at Mosquito Island -Relaxing and swimming around the beautiful Bamboo island -Admiring colorful corals and fishes at Rantee Bay Take a step into paradise with us and bring home memories of a lifetime.
strTitle: See Sharks & Colorful Fishes on Majestic Bamboo Island

strIntroduction: Join us on a fantastic day to Maya Bay, a stunningly beautiful bay in Koh Phi Phi with soft white sand and crystal clear waters! You can visit Monkey Beach to feed and play with the monkeys! Or jump from an 18m high cliff and snorkel with colorful fishes around Koh Phi Phi Lay island. Unwind on Maya Bay and take in the stunning view while enjoying your lunch. Take a boat ride out to see the magical sunset, right before going for a night swim with glowing plankton! Take a step into paradise with us, and bring home an experience of a lifetime.
strTitle: Feed Monkeys and Swim with Glowing Plankton in Maya Bay

strIntroduction: Discover the clearest waters in Phi Phi from the top of the majestic Pi-Leh Lagoon. Deep Water Soloing is the most natural form of climbing. We will go to an area within the lagoon where the water is deep and there are steep rocks from the cliffs nearby that you can climb right from the boat. With no ropes or anchors to secure you, it is only you and the beautiful Thai limestone. Our experienced instructors will teach you how to climb different levels of difficulty, ranging from climbing close to the water, to heading straight up via an easier route for a 20 meter jump!
strTitle: Experience Deep Water Solo Within a Secluded Lagoon

strIntroduction: Chinese fortune telling, breakfast in a temple, the contrasts of spiritual Bangkok and rush-hour Bangkok, skyscraper canyons and ancient neighborhoods, motorbike taxis and speedboats, Buddhist chants and chillout tunes, neighborhood foodstalls and cosmopolitan skybars, spectacular skyline views and cultural conservation projects, bustling markets and mystical alleys, vertical slums and offbeat artist communities. These are a few of the characteristics in which we will immerse to experience our hometown unmasked. We’re proud to tell visitors the story of our city through a unique, intense, exciting, fun and insightful route that takes you on foot and on all available public transportation to see Bangkok from the eye of the local and to understand the challenges of an Asian megacity in the 21st century. Bangkok Three-Sixty is designed by locals, crafted through the passion of die-hard Bangkok fans and explorers, conservationist and foodies. You don’t have to go through all the pitfalls to experience the true essence and soul of Bangkok, we’re happy to deliver an experience that reflects the realities and magnitude of one of Asia’s greatest cities. Sightseeing is so yesterday.
strTitle: Explore Bangkok like a local, with locals

strIntroduction: [Agriculture Experience will vary depending on seasons] Guests will get to harvest seasonal vegetables, crops and fruits and eat them as the same time. Harvest of rice (both thai and sticky), vegetables, herbs and fruits unique to the land will be included as part of the experience. After the activity, we will provide freshly harvested rice, vegetables and chicken dishes for our guests. Long-term stay is also available. Generally, we offer stays ranging from 7 days to 3 months. Various agricultural activities are also available upon request and depending on the season.
strTitle: Get a hands-on farming experience in Thailand

strIntroduction: Historically, canals have been the highways of choice for Thai people, resulting in the nickname being given by Western visitors to Bangkok as the "Venice of the East". Join us for a two hour trip of exploration along the ancient canals of Thunburi. This tour will display the many elements of the 'canal life' that once characterized all of Bangkok before wheeled motor vehicles came into prominence. After a short walk from our Chinatown starting point, we will board a longtail boat to take us across the Chao Phraya River to Thonburi. Here, we will enter the canal system and see an abundance of interesting wooden homes on stilts, temples, and markets oriented towards water life. Along the way, we will make a few short stops to explore some of these sights up close. Perfect for the non-cyclist, photo enthusiast, and anybody with a curious mind, this tour will fill you with intrigue. Departures is at 10:00 in the morning, returning at noon.
strTitle: Explore the ancient canals of Bangkok

strIntroduction: Go rocket boating in the canals of Bangkok! Throughout the years, the canals of Bangkok have been traversed by a dizzying array of exotic watercraft, from the omnipresent long tail boat to the noodle vending canoe. None have more cache locally than the "James Bond boat" (aka rocket boat), named for its appearance in the 1974 Bond thriller 'The Man with the Golden Gun'. In this half day adventure, we will combine cultural exploration with high-speed thrills for your own Bond-like experience in Thailand. Our journey begins as a Chao Phraya River Express Boat takes us on a relaxing cruise north to the town of Nonthaburi. We will take a short stroll in this village where we visit a local market. Tourists hardly even visit this place. Then we return to the pier, to board a long tail boat bringing us into a canal system unlike those found closer to the city. Peaceful scenes of rural canal life will transport you to a simpler, more innocent time, when the days pass slowly and the worries are few. After an hour, the appearance of rocket boats signals a dramatic change of pace. Instant thrills ensue as high speed manoeuvring through narrow canals will bring out the 'inner child' and "secret agent" in us all. Adrenalin rush complete, another long tail boat will brings us back to Chinatown.
strTitle: Ride a Rocket Boat in the canals of Bangkok

strIntroduction: Unique walking tour in Bangkok's authentic Chinatown Join us for a two hour stroll through historic Chinatown, one of the largest and most authentic in the world. Here, Sino-Thai culture has been evolving since the beginning of the Chakri dynasty and the crowning of King Rama I over 200 years ago. Enjoy many of the same elements that made Co's bicycle tours so popular in a more relaxed and intimate format. Explore alleyways and passages so small that even bicycles cannot pass. Get a behind-the-scenes view of life in this bustling community, where encounters with marketplaces, religious shrines, and smiling faces performing their daily routines will stimulate all your senses. Perfect for the photo enthusiast, our walking tour gives you ample opportunities to explore at your own pace so you can ask questions and take it all in.
strTitle: Take a walk in Bangkok's unique Chinatown

strIntroduction: An alternative to our Chinatown tours and conveniently located near the popular traveler mecca of Khao San Road, our tour will explore the historic community of Bang Lamphu through routes familiar only to locals. Departing from the New World City Hotel, we will go behind the flashing lights of Khao San Road to begin our cultural adventure. Leaving crowded traditional tourist attractions for your guidebook to detail, we will bring you along a path of discovery not found in any of them. Wooden framed houses, noisy schoolyards, and bustling markets are just a few examples of scenes you might find on our wander into the common but always fascinating life styles of the Thai people. Next, we cross the Chao Phraya River over the breath-taking Rama VIII Bridge to historic Thonburi. With expansive views of the river still fresh in our memories, encounters with surprising green belts free of cars and tourists will signal your arrival to a Bangkok you never knew.
strTitle: Bike Khao San Road's hidden streets and back alleys

strIntroduction: Our school focuses on authentic Thai cuisine and provides friendly and professional instructors. Our cooking classes are easy to learn. We will even take you to go shopping to buy your own Thai food ingredients so that it will be easier for you to remember and learn about the cuisine. Our local market is very rustic, retaining the authentic Thai lifestyle. Besides cooking, there are a lot of things to learn as well during our trip to the market and our classes. In this course, you will choose seven dishes, one of each category, including making curry paste.
strTitle: Learn to cook authentic Thai cuisine

strIntroduction: Of course people in Thailand can't understand Japanese. But they know one Japanese word. That is "OISHI". This word is as same as the name of company in Thailand, so they can understand it. If you go travel in Thailand and say "OISHI" in a restaurant, people there will understand you and be happy. You'll be glad if people understand what you are talking? In order to get easier to make people understand you, here is one lesson. That is "Make your tour awesome by Thai lesson in Thailand". There are lots of accents in Thai. If you buy a Thai language book before travel, mostly you'll end up not communicating with people. In this lesson, there are just minimum required words for travel. But i f you know some, you'll enjoy more. "Words used on a taxi" "Words used in shopping" "Words used at a hotel" This lesson will support your travel and safety. For your trip, Thai people and your safety, please take this lesson! Besides, you also can experience Thai food because this lesson includes drink and lunch at the restaurant "J-cafe". Let's join us!
strTitle: Make your tour awesome by Thai lesson in Thailand 2hours

strIntroduction: This is the lesson for people who are not satisfied with 2-hours course. We'll teach you not only conversations just for travel but also ones for making friends in Thailand. There are some techniques in languages. So we'll pick up what the most important part is for leaning Thai and teach you them. Then you'll feel "I can speak Thai!!!!" though this lesson. After 2-hours lesson which is a basic version, you'll take more 2-hours lesson which is a practical one. Between 2 lesson, you can have a lunch, so let's use Thai at the time! Pleasure in trip is enjoying people and cultures in the country, Let's have a fun in Thailand through this opportunity.
strTitle: Make your tour awesome by Thai lesson in Thailand 4hours

strIntroduction: Do you like Thailand? Do you like Thai people and the culture? Why not study Thai then? It is one of the most beautiful languages, as the sounds and tones are almost melodic. With your knowledge of Thai, you can communicate with the locals directly. We are a translation company with language experts, and will provide you with a day's worth of effective and interesting Thai lessons. The teachers are university students! As you know it is impossible to speak a new language after a one day lesson. But, you will understand the essence of the language and remember some useful words and phrases. We provide three courses. "First Speak Thai in My Life", "Survival in The Country" and "Master of Thai Conversation." After a day of Thai lessons, you will be the object of envy and wonder as you chatter away in simple and useful Thai phrases!
strTitle: One Day Thai Lesson by University Students
